description:
I recently moved further down the block from this cafe.  During my move, it was my go-to lunch spot because it was along the way to my new apartment.

I took my mom out here for lunch as she was helping me move.  She was pretty amazed that a tiny coffee shop would have good sandwiches, at a good price!  I've had several of their sandwiches, and I have never been disappointed.  The breakfast bagel sandwiches are standard, and a fast way to fill up if you're on the run.  They have other snacks available, like knishes and pastries.

There's plenty of places to sit, and there's many places to be able to plug in your device.  It seems to be a hangout for college students and writers, so it can be on the quieter side, which is a nice environment for studying.

Service has always been fast and friendly.  And they have free wifi.  If you want to support a local business, you should buy your next sandwich and coffee here.
author: Vira P.

description:
Great sandwich spot! I came here a few good times and never had any complaints. 

The San Francisco Sandwich - It comes with turkey, bacon, avocado, lettuce, tomato, onion, pickles, Swiss cheese, mayo, all on a soft roll. I've never really met a sandwich I didn't like and this sandwich was no exception. Yum! Hits the spot and definitely gave me what I was looking for. Savory with a good balance of sour puckering from the pickles and onions. This is their most popular sandwich, btw. 

You will pay about $8-9, but this is the city so it is to be expected.

Service was extremely quick and they do offer free wifi. The Café is large and very open. I usually get my order to go so I don't spend much time inside. The bathrooms are clean and they do take pride in making sure the café has a clean appearance. There is ample seating to choose from, so if you want to sit for a while to do some work on your laptop, it is a perfect place to chill. Parking can be a pain if the meters in front are unavailable. If I am in the area I like to visit this place before the local high school lets out. It can get a little overcrowded for a short period.
author: Ann S.

description: Terrible terrible place; got to the register to pay, there was a roach running around so I naturally screamed lol they looked @ me as if I was delusional even when I said "there's a roach here please kill it, I can't". The cashier was a young girl the fact that I had seen a roach did not seem to even phase her! Then the older guy wearing glasses came by, "trying to look for the roach" but every time I would point at the terrified roach he would move things around & be like "where, where, I don't see it".Finally, I got offended to have them ignore my concern as a customer. I said, you know you guys really have to catch it and kill it, specially since you serve food here  I walked off saying "sorry, I just can't eat here, you can cancel my order"
author: Celine B.

description: Cafe Enchante and its sister cafe, Cafe Promenade, are both great coffee / sandwich / work on your laptop spots. Good and very reasonably priced food, friendly staff, consistent wifi, and they're both open until 10 PM. I prefer the size and layout of Promenade, but it's a bit further out in the avenues.
author: Nick C.

description:
This place is so spacious and has lots of options for breakfast lunch and dinner or just dessert for a cafe. 
The mocha I had was delicious. They have good service. This is my place to read a book and have a tea.
author: Juan V.

description: Amazing atmosphere for someone who likes to work out of a cafe. The prices are super reasonable, the food is delicious and there's always enough space.
author: Lucas T.

description:
Help! My local Starbucks has taken out all their outlets!! My go to, Home Cafe is always crowded and I need to get work done! Enter Cafe Enchante. 

I remember stopping by this cafe on my way to do my first hike in San Francisco. The cafe had comfy sofas, lots of tables and wasn't crowded. It was such a pleasant space, a great pit stop for my tired feet and I knew I would return. Fast forward two years, here I am, right now - Cafe Enchante is saving my butt yet again. 

With coffee and food offerings, outlets aplenty, and lots of tables/sofas - this is an ideal place to sit down and be productive. It's so rare to find these cafes nowadays. I really, really appreciate an establishment like this, and it feels welcoming for every type of person since there are different open spaces, high and low tables, quiet corners, sofa chill spaces etc. You can even play chess on some of these tables. But the major thing is - you can do work here. The coffee is pretty decent. The staff are welcoming and on top of everything. It definitely is a place to be enchanted by because spaces like this are getting to be more and more rare! So glad this exists!
author: Deanna S.

description: Cafe Enchante is a great go-to neighborhood cafe. The bagel sandwiches are all delicious, the coffee is good, and the service is quick. This is a great place to grab a coffee and chat with friends or get work done if you need to. Casual and no pretension.
author: Josh P.

description:
I've been working around this area for four years now and bare discovered this place! It is so cute and perfect to get work done.

The Menu offers anything from hot to iced coffee/tea, smoothies, breakfast, specialty sandwiches, veggies sandwiches, and wraps. They also offer cereal, bars, ramen, cookies, and other baked goods. The prices are also very reasonable. I ordered the Smoked Salmon Specialty Sandwich, which is probably the most expensive sandwich on the menu, and a large iced vanilla latte. It was $13 !

The environment is definitely a working place. Many many tables and sitting areas to do work in, have a small business meeting in, etc. There is music playing in the background, but it's not very bothering (at least not to me).

This place includes free WiFi, clean bathroom, and tons of charging cables. The staff is super friendly and amicable. They really make you feel like you're in someones home and that they will take care of you.

So happy I found this cute place, and will definitely be back!
author: Kassie E.

description: Great selection of bagels and sandwiches, at a still reasonable price for the city. The coffee and drinks menu is what you expect in most cafes, but the London Fog is especially delicious! The real highlight of this cafe is the calm and cool atmosphere accented by the lovely french village charm of the themed decor. I can definitely see myself here often catching a quick meal, or staying a while to get some work done in the comfortable seating areas.
author: Adam A.

description:
Love this neighborhood spot! Free WiFi means it's hard to find a seat sometimes if you're actually here to eat and chill but the made to order food is great to go as well. I recommend the smoked salmon sandwich, veggie wrap and all of the smoothies and coffee drinks. 

My favorite part about the food is that any of the breakfast sandwiches can be made veggie style! 

The staff is super friendly and remembers my preferences which gives it a welcoming feel from order to exit.
author: Natalie W.

description: Looking for somewhere to pick up food to take to the park, we happened upon this place. It was relatively empty for a Saturday afternoon which meant fast service. I got the San Francisco sandwich which was pretty big for such a decent price. We also got some slices of carrot and banana bread which were super soft and yummy. They have a huge selection of sandwiches and pastries so I'd love to come back to try more; their coffee too!
author: Pooja C.

description:
A very cute hole in the wall coffee show located on Geary. A great place to study and do homework. The interior painting is spectacular and adds a very modern, artsy feel to it.

When I walked in for the first time I got a ice coffee with vanilla and a French soda with peach, both of which were so good!

Service was very friendly and helpful when I asked them about what a French soda was and other details about their menu.


Their sandwiches are also very good and at a good price also! The breakfast bagel with cheddar and sausage is very good! I also ordered the lady lox bagel, and it had the most lox on a bagel Iv ever had.

Overall a great,cozy neighborhood coffee shop with good service,food and drinks. Be sure to stop by for a warm drink on those cold San Francisco mornings!
author: Jonathan B.

description: Great place to study, read, or work. Lots of space, generally not too crowded, and the wifi is excellent. Food is decent, not amazing, but also not expensive. I love this place because it's a good study spot.
author: Easton A.

description: I like this bright cafe. It has relatively large space with many small wooden tables. It has reasonable amounts of power outlets, decent home coffee and sandwiches. I do suggest it if you want to work for several hours out of your office/home.
author: Reza T.

description:
The cafe is mostly excellent. It's some customers who are destroying the atmosphere and make some people uncomfortable. On regular basis a guy comes in with his kids. They take up both couches. They speak very loudly and then he is reading them some books and commenting on politics loudly. At least he and some other customers should see that most people are trying to read and study. It's just common courtesy. Some people just want to sit and relax and these kids and dad take up everything. Once again. This is not the cafe's management's fault.

In the evening you may often see various shady people come in and out. Watch your laptops.

Please make the coffee better. These days we know what coffee tastes good and what coffee sucks. Most of the time coffee here is ok. Not good but passable. It tastes like the beans weren't ground that day but instead tasted like stale old coffee from coffee that was ground days ago. Please, it's so simple. Just grind coffee beans in the morning or couple times per day. Otherwise everyone immediately know that the coffee is made from some week old ground coffee. If you charge full price almost like coffee chains then it should be little better. Sorry!
author: Monkey C.

description: This is a great cafe for students. Prices are very reasonable. There is plenty of seating and plenty of outlets and extension cords. They have sandwiches, pastries, bagels, and the coffee is not bad. The ambiance is very calming, perfect for a first date. The area in the back looks like they turned the inside into an outdoor seating like space. Painted walls, a piano, chess tables, a fountain, like being in an indoor park area. Couches if you want something more cozy. They charge $2 for bathroom use to non customers though so don't come here if you just need to take a leak. Love it.
author: Tatiana T.

description: Love this place. I stop by here every morning for a coffee and bagel. Super affordable and really kind staff. Great for doing work at too.
author: Taylor D.

description:
One of my favorite places to study and eat. Sandwich selection is pretty good. It looks like it's run and owned by a family. Nice alternative to a chain coffee shops. Plenty of seating and really privacy oriented. I keep coming here for a few years and I see that a lot people work from here.

PS Never order their cold wraps, flour tortilla was not fully cooked.
author: Sagdi F.

description:
The coffee, sandwiches, and baked goods are all fairly decent, but what's best about this venue is the authentic neighborhood feel and vibe. There's lots of seating, colorfully painted walls, and the people who run this place seem authentically nice and cheery. Even if there are lines, they move fast too.

Certainly a good independent alternative to a chain establishment.
author: Vincent L.

description:
3.5/5- Rounding up because I do really like the decor of 80% of the room and there are a a lot of seats.

Was looking for a place to study and decided to give this place a shot after seeing the gorgeous photos online. Unfortunately the photos don't necessarily show the corner you're more likely to end up sitting in (because of how busy this place gets) is poorly lit and looks like the inside of a janitor's closet. 

But before I get into all that. This place does have plenty of street parking in the area, the service is not the nicest but they do their job professionally, there's plenty of seating, and there's free wifi. I didn't see any outlets in the area I was seated in (back, more dimly lit corner). And of course I love the atmosphere of the cafe. It has a whimsical pseudo-European vibe that lives up to the "enchante" name. The menu on the other hand is pretty straight forward. It has some sandwiches and pastries along with your basic cafe items. I ended up getting a matcha blended drink. It was fine. The matcha quality wasn't great but the drink was blended well and a had a good balance of sweetness. 

Overall, I do like this cafe. The drinks are nothing special but maybe I just need to try the actual coffee. I would love to eventually come back on a less crowded day.
author: Vivian C.

description:
Great location not far from Ocean Beach and Lands End, easy parking most days, very nice owners, easy on the Wallet, coupled along with great assortment of foods. 

Plenty of seats, couches and tables. I work in SF curtains days of the week so it is a normal stopping point for me to grab, coffee and log on to internet to get some quick work done.
author: Jonathan F.

description:
Been here twice for some morning Bagel sandwiches. The lady behind the counter is always nice and helpful!

Bagel sandwiches are pretty good and filling! I usually get the Lady Lox which is awesome! Pricing is a little steep, but it's alright because it is convenient and tastes good.
author: James D.

description:
The service was mehh for me. I placed my order and cashier kept talking and talking to her associate while the lady behind me was waiting to place her order and I was waiting for my latte. After they finally placed her order they continued to talk and forgot the lady ordered a baked good.

Finally when I got my latte - it sucked. The latte lacked flavor and the milk was super dense. There was no love involved in making my latte, just talking.
author: Sam W.

description:
This is my favorite place in a town for tasty eat and spend friendly time . 
My furniture store located in opposite street side and I business owner . During hard working day I would like to make a pause and I go in this Beautifull cafe 
I usually got Green tea and sandwich . 
Also all my staff in business always go only there There is always all tasty , fresh  and quiet place with nice jazz music on a background , soft couches , and nice french oil paint  wall art with street in France picture on it   
Customer service incredible good , they all always smile and meet you like your part of them family !  
I really recommend this place for Business meetings , relax tea or coffee time !
author: Marina S.

description: I've been here a few times now and it's a great local cafe but today I used their restroom while I waited for my food. It was recently cleaned and the floor was still really wet in places. I didn't realize this and slipped and fell fully on the floor. I'm fine so far, besides having a stiff neck and an achy torso from the fall, but someone could really get hurt. They didn't have a wet floor sign up in the bathroom and when I told both owners (I assume they are the owners) about my fall they both responded with "ok".  They didn't seem to care, so if you know people who go here, give them a heads up and tell them to be careful.
author: Molly H.

description: One of the few places in the area that was open on a Tuesday afternoon.  There is ample seating, and the prices are very reasonable.  The sandwiches are delicious, and the bathroom was spotless.
author: Kathryn B.

description: Busy, but still cozy and quiet Sunday night trying to do some studying. Clean. I didn't had to wipe my own tables. Coffee, hmmm, not the best, next time I'll order got chocolate. Power outlets for laptops, remember to bring your own extension. This might be my regular studying place now.
author: Jen L.

description:
Pros:
Great place to tuck away to get studying done. 

They won't kick you out! You can literally hide all day if you wanted.

Good mocha...very strong. 

Love the music - Michael Buble, Frank Sinatra and the like. 


Cons:
Tables are small, can't fit a textbook + your laptop on it. You'll have to awkwardly juggle them between your lap and table.

Credit card minimum of $5.

Not the most trendy coffee shop in town, the newest, or beautiful. It is what it is.
author: Jocelyn L.

description: Pretty decent availability of outlets for studying or working. Good selection of beverages and food. The prices were average.
author: Kristine C.

description: First time here tonight. I recently moved to the neighborhood and was looking for a local place to do homework that also provides coffee, free wifi, plugs, and spacious. Cafe Enchante is a great place to grab a coffee and work. The vibe is chill, with eclectic decor that rings true of a local shop. Take the time to check out the place and support this local business!
author: Justin M.

description: Had the breakfast bagel. It was okay and kinda dry. It lacked flavor. The cashier was nice.
author: Antonella H.

description:
A real welcoming cozy cafe with free wifi, which is one of my favorite places to grab a quick breakfast or coffee at an affordable price. It's relaxing enough to check your emails and not overly crowded with stressed out people like you will find in other more mainstream cafes. 

I have tried their bagels and sandwiches and they are both excellent choices.
author: Melly C.

description: My go to coffee shop now because it's right down the block from me and it's rather roomy.  Lots of plugs around the edges of the place and is relatively quiet for a busy place. The two others seem nice and keep a good smile even when they have to run around the whole day.  The furniture is a bit old but it gives character to the place.  I sat here one day for maybe 4 hours after ordering a chai latte and turnover, both good. They come around cleaning and wiping down tables when they aren't swamped with customers.  Ask them for the WiFi password because I didn't notice any signs and was too lazy to get up and ask so I just did stuff offline. Great place to escape to if you don't want to work at home!
author: Jasmine C.

description: This cafe is cute in its own way with the different furniture, layouts, reading displays, and lights. The setting is calm and quiet, even when there are a handful of people sitting within different areas of the Cafe. When it comes to the quality of the drinks and the pastries, they are decent.
author: Stacey M.

description:
I asked what brand they brew and the lady at the counter couldn't tell me. I asked and she gave me a blank face. I thought she might have not heard me and repeated myself. She replied "coffee". Duuuhh 

My BF ordered a chia latte. The register said it was $4 but the lady charged me $4.30. I ask why it was more when the register read "$4". The woman said the register's screen was broken. What?!! I saw "4.00" but the tablet to pay w/ a credit card read $4.30. I immediately knew I was scammed. I get it, if you're going to charge me a convenience fee for a credit card - just be honest and tell me. Totally wrong and bad business practices.
author: Johan S.

description:
A neighborhood cafe with a lot of charm and personality! The walls a decked out with murals of French street shops and there are plants spaced all over. 

There was plenty of seating, FREE wifi, and relaxing music to get work done. I felt really comfortable here and will definitely be back! There was a lot of options for drinks and light snacks, I only had the green tea while I was here but sure everything else is just as good.
author: Daniel P.

description:
You can call it spacious, but it is a cell of coldness. I come here first time with my wife after dinner. We want to have some chat and rest and order a cup of coffee. I was too full and ask the only old lady there politely for a key to restroom. She asked, are you a customer ? Of Course, I said and pointed to the coffee we just ordered. She teased and said in a way you barely heard, You have two people but only one coffee, it doesn't count. 
Oh my God. No comment for this kind of service. No mentioning the coffee is just so-so.
author: Wenhong X.

description: It's a decent place for study/work.  You've got plenty of tables and outlets to charge laptop/phones.  But the wifi is super slow (please upgrade) and ordering things can be a hassle.  So essentially this cafe provides a decent environment for doing your work but without wifi that works properly, it's kind of hard to do your work.  I use my phone's hotspot to connect when their connection drops which happens often.  Bottom line: if you've got your hotspot or are ok with dodgy connection, then this place will work for you.
author: Sami W.

description: Great vibe in this spacey cafe. I met a good friend here, suggested by the high-rating on yelp, and it did not disappoint. Plenty of couches and room to relax or converse.
author: Eduardo P.

description: This is a charming coffee shop at Geary and 25th. Met someone here for a conversation and had a hot apple cider and a breakfast bagel with egg, sausage, and provolone cheese. It's clean and service is good.
author: Denise C.

description: Super slow wifi, very unclean place especially the restroom, the elderly worker is very impolite... I'm not going to visit this place again.
author: Mel M.

description:
I really like this place. Affordable good sandwiches, great coffee, and really nice staff. 

My only complaint is their use of the bug zapping tennis racket to zap the flies. Don't get me wrong, very clean place but have to think their is a better way to control the flies than exploding them over the food and coffee prep area. Hasn't deterred me from going here but thought they should know. My 2 cents.
author: Kevin S.

description:
Great spot for coffee, and great customer service. All the staff are hospitable and kind.  Their espresso is strong and flavorful, perfect for my capp!  I like the hummus bagel, tasty, and its veggie friendly.
Free Wi-Fi, spacious, and the ambience is relaxing.  Special thanks to Vanna for my mocha blend, and to Natalia who poured me a perf cup of cappuccino just the way I like: super dry!!!
author: Amerizza Q.

description: Great selection, well priced, prompt, nice family that runs the place. The location is great as well, although can be busy in that area on Sunday due to church traffic.
author: Jeffrey G.

description:
I had the Chai Latte and it was really good. The service was really efficient and ambience is wonderful. It's the same as Le Promenade -- spacious, with couchs, different tables and many options of power outlets -- but somehow with a nicer atmosphere. 

They were out of blended drinks, though. And there was a small fruit fly hovering over the pastries (no almond croissant for me). 

pros: great for working, good service

cons: out of blended drinks, fly on the pastries
author: Andréia S.

description: Cute. Ok wifi and not the fastest especially if you do stuff like uploading. I like their russian cookies. Outlets arent bad but bring extension chord just im case
author: Jasmina D.

description:
PSA....please do your mouth a favor and order the San Franciscan sandwich!  It is one of my favorite sandwiches in ALL of SF, hands down. I used to live down the street from Cafe Enchante and would order this sandwich at least once a week.

Why are you till reading this-- you should be running there.
author: Nicole G.

description: Very impressive. From first glances to customer service, it's the staycation spot I needed.
author: Angela F.

description:
Decided to come here for a Sunday cup of coffee and wish I can rewind and never experience this place.
-Staff speaks broken  English to the point of trouble with comprehension-I had to repeat each phrase two times
-I said "thank you" after placing my order and staff did not give me the common courtesy of saying something along the lines of "thank you" or "you are welcome"
-placed and order and one of the baristas clarified with me that the order is "for here". Then handler me  "to go" cups. No big deal. 
-Tables are dirty and no-one cares to clean them even once in a while. Crumbs, bits of avocado, droplets of spilled coffee. Polite request to staff to clean the table went ignored twice. No apologies or effort whatsoever to overcome this string of service carries.  
-Cafe overseas a beautiful cathedral on the intersection of Geary/26th Avenue and yet all the windows are covered with some kind of plants that obstruct both the  view and natural light inside 
-this place has seating for 20-25 patrons and yet there is one single occupancy restroom that's perpetually occupied and requires and unsanitary key attached to a chain to gain entry.
Respect yourself and do not come here if you want a cafe experience and not a run down coffee joint.
Coffee was average.
author: Alex G.

description: Strolled in here for dessert on a double date with my husband and parents after eating at Jang Soo BBQ across the street. This place is absolutely adorable! I love how spacious it is and the Parisian theme is so pretty. We ordered chocolate mousse cake and dipped chocolate chip cookies with some decaf coffee and everything was delicious. The barista was very sweet and patient as well. 5/5 overall.
author: Hannah S.

description:
Pro: friendly service, pretty interior, nice music choice, plenty of seats, free wifi, lots of outlets
Con: unfortunately coffee wasn't that good, my white chocolate latte tasted quite bland - too much water. 

Overall, I love everything else besides the actual coffee sadly (and I'm not a picky coffee drinker). Would love to make this a regular spot but I guess I'll just keep exploring.
author: T L.

description: The people who work here are super friendly. There is a bunch of seating and ample outlets placed throughout. The wifi is speedy, craps out maybe a handful of times in the many times I've been there, but I think that's understandable for the amount of ppl in there, and it's been back up in a matter of minutes. There are sofas and tables for whatever you prefer. And the sandwiches are yum! So is the blended ice chai. There is rarely a good selection of chips however. Still love this place.
author: Fab E.

description:
I love getting work done here. Lots of couches, light, chill atmosphere. Cafe is just decent- the food is like college food and you can tell they do the bare minimum but who cares? This is a fun, chill place to get work done. 

I like that the bathroom is clean and that people are respectful to each other. Very chill vibe without a super social atmosphere (unlike la promenade). 

I've had mostly teas here as that's what I prefer to drink when I'm studying. They have a decent selection.
author: Priya S.

description: Cute little cafe right off the Main Street... love the internal  decor; Parisian vibes, high ceilings, a mixture of couches and tables. The music is very light and isn't overpowering which really allows you to work and study here if you wanted (plus they got free wifi!!!). They got food that's less than $7?!?? What place in sf can afford to keep the prices so low but give you so much?!! Bought a veggie bagel and added sausage (cuz I'm a rebel) and they did not skimp on the avocado. Mocha was really good too and they even nailed it with some foam on top! Best bang for buck in the area, for sure! I'll be back (like Arnold).
author: Kanoa U.

description: This place rocks!  Very difficult to understand how Vincent L can deem its sandwiches to be only "fairly decent".  The sandwich I just devoured was as good as any I've ever had - generous amount of ripe avocado, savory well-prepared bacon, cheese melted just right and the whole thing toasted to perfection.
author: David S.

description:
This establishment is located on Geary Blvd and 26th Ave with only street metered parking that's fairly difficult to find (or if you're lucky enough to find residential parking). Very dim cafe with a pretty mural by the seating area. When you walk in, there's a sign on the center of the door stating that the restrooms were for customers only. For non-customers, there would be a $2 charge. That alone already made me hesitant to go in because it gave me a feeling that they would be a shop that is going to nickle-and-dime everything. I was in desperate need of caffeine though so I pushed my doubts aside and went in.

Menu:
Coffee Drinks: SML / MED / LRG
House Coffee: $1.75 / $2 / $2.25
Espresso: $1.75 / $2.25 / $2.75
Cafe au Lait: $2.25 / $2.60 / $2.95
Americano: $2.60 / $2.85 / $3.20
Red Eye: $2.25 / $2.75 / $3.25
Cafe Latte: $2.75 / $3.25 / $3.75
Flavored Latte: $3 / $3.50 / $4
Cappuccino: $2.75 / $3.25 / $3.75
Macchiato: $2.25 / $2.75 / $3.25
Mocha:  $3 / $3.50 / $4
White Chocolate:  $3 / $3.50 / $4
Caramel:  $3 / $3.50 / $4
Vanilla: $3 / $3.50 / $4

Extras:
Espresso Shot / Mocha Powder / Vanilla Powder / Flavored Syrup +$0.60
Soy Milk / Steamed Milk / Protein Powder / Breve +$0.75

Non-Coffee Drinks: SML / MED / LRG
Chai Tea: $2.75 / $3.25 / $3.75
Hot Chocolate: $2.50 / $2.95 / $3.45
Hot Apple Cider: $2.50 / $2.75 / $3
Italian Soda: - / $2.60 / $3
French Soda: - / $2.85 / $3.25
Assorted Tea: - / $1.75 / $2
Pot of Tea: - / - / $3

Blended drinks: MED: $3.95 / LRG: $4.25
Mocha / Vanilla / Caramel / White Chocolate 
Chai Tea
Green Tea

Smoothies: SML: $3.95 / LRG: $4.45
Strawberry / Peach / Mango / Banana / Pineapple

Glass display stands next to the register with cakes and pastries which none looked fresh. There's a sign behind the cabinet advertising hot piroshki's but we saw them sitting in the case with an old grimy-looking microwave sitting on a small table behind the counter.They also have bagels and sandwiches (including paninis & melts) available for purchase.

Our Order:
Blended Mocha
Triple Shot Espresso

My typical go-to drink is a mocha but since it was so hot that day, I wanted a cold drink. I should've stuck to my gut and got the hot drink because my blended mocha was a cup of sugar and hardly any caffeine. Should've just gotten that sundae at Twirl and Dip as it would've been a better use of my calories & sugar intake! =/ My friend had the espresso and poured some of it into my drink but it tasted like they burned the espresso and made the drink worse. My friend didn't care though because he can eat/drink nearly anything and doesn't know any better. ^^;;

The Chinese couple working behind the counter wasn't friendly or welcoming. Just there to work it seems. I have no inclinations on coming back.

$5 minimum for credit cards
author: Kitty K.

description:
Great place to relax and get some work done. 

And, their sandwiches are simply amazing!!
author: Wayne A.

description: Good place. Comfortable. ATM. Take credit cards over $5. SF is a coffee city and the espresso drinks are not up to any North Beach standard. A tiny sliver of ice cold "strudel" didn't help. This is a cozy neighborhood spot to have a cup of drip coffee and hang out and know your money is not going to "the man" or "the mermaid."
author: Brian B.

description:
Ok, I might be a little biased as this place is down the block from where I live but I come here pretty often to study and get my work done. I love their interiors and sometimes sipping my coffee here makes me feel like I am in Paris! :p

 They got descent speed free wifi, plenty of space, charging points and a regular coffee menu that you would find anywhere. I really wish they could have a more pleasant menu as I have to go out for lunch if I come here because my food experience hasn't been good here so far.
author: Pratibha S.

description: this is one of my favorite coffee shops in the city. i used to come here a lot to study by myself or with classmates. the drinks here are cheap and there's free wifi. there's plenty of tables and outlets for you to use your electronic devices. there's also free self-served water. there's only one restroom but it's pretty clean. the staff is super friendly and nice. their hours are pretty good here. i've been internet-less for a while so i've been coming to this coffee shop to use the wifi. i'm not a coffee person so i usually order tea or something else. i ordered a medium size pomegranate & raspberry green tea which costs $2.01. i think that's a really good deal compared to most coffee shops. i definitely recommend this place as a good study/work spot.
author: Sylvia H.

description: I had a veg sandwich called Monalisa. Tasted good. They could've done better in seats though, not so comfortable for longer hours.
author: Maulik S.

description: Everything is pretty good food and drink wise. The place offers ample seating for groups and for when you're alone. Good sandwiches. They'll make all of their sandwiches into a wrap if you request it.
author: Jacob M.

description: The atmosphere is great for studying and working. Lots of computer outlets, tables and light. Drinks aren't good except the regular coffee. Veggie sandwich was ok, but the tomatoes weren't ripe yet. Service was quick but not overly friendly. Prices are good. Overall, not bad.
author: Chris H.

description: Decent service. Mural inside was beautiful and WiFi worked fine. Minimum $5 for charge so 4 stars, but otherwise a great experience.
author: Bienvenido A.

description:
I don't know how I ended up here or how I found this place- but this is probably the best coffee shop in San Francisco. Cheap prices, great food, really nice employees, tons of tables, tons of outlets, and really friendly people.
SF secret bucket list for sure.
author: James H.

description:
We all have off days, and perhaps that was true for both myself and the woman who messed up my order last time.

Today she got it perfectly. A good lesson in how we should all be a bit slower with our judgements.

Back to being my regular stop before heading to work.
author: Jeff R.

description:
3.5 Stars. A neighborhood cafe that opens early, closes late, located conveniently on Geary Blvd, and has a pretty extensive drinks / sandwiches menu.

The cafe is spacious and comfortable. Plenty of seats/couches and WIFI for customers.

Like some Yelpers suggested, they make a great Chai Latte! So creamy! Great Macchiato also. Good breakfast bagels and croissants to pair your morning cup of caffeine. This is not a destination coffee house but convenient to stop in if you're nearby.
author: Jing D.

description:
I spend my life here studying. I've been to cafes all over the city in every single neighborhood because that's my life, studying. This place, hands down, has it all for someone who needs to get work done. Minus good food and quality coffee. Their food selection is pretty dull and the coffee is average, pre-brewed and sits in canisters. 

What they lack in quality food and drink, they more than make up in business as a whole. This place can stay surprisingly quiet even with 20 or so people, amazing. Outlets everywhere. Opens a lot earlier than most cafes in the city. There are 3 couches and 3 comfy lounge chairs. The music is always interesting and eclectic set at the right decibel. The staff can get a little flustered, they seem to always rotate like any other cafe. 

I wouldn't pick any other place to do work.
author: Elton F.

description:
Had a bagel with cream cheese, tomato, avocado and sprouts.
The tomato was green (and it wasn't an heirloom) and the avocado was hard....as in totally unripe.

Latte was fine.

The atmosphere was nice...this is a good place to study.  Next time I'll get a cookie or something. 3 stars for being a good place to study with coffee.
author: El B.

description: I love this place. Great to study. Really great sandwiches, like really great. I love the San Francisco. Coffee is only decent, but the price is right.
author: Julia M.

description:
Got work to do and can't make that happen at home? Enchante has your back. 10 stars for the couches and outlets and wi-fi, oh my! 

All things considered and incorporated, a solid 3 stars for coffee, cheesecake, vibes, and creepy couch coverings. I like this place, but only because I can kick it there comfortably and indefinitely and not starve to death.
author: Rachel R.

description: My favorite place to work on papers and anything I've been putting off. I found this place off Yelp when I couldn't focus on my work at home anymore. Ever since I first came here, I've been hooked. Coffee is great (and cheap) they have yummy bites, which is great when you're here for a few hours typing away. Plus it's a super cozy feel, and it really is enchanting. The owners are super sweet, I've never had a bad experience. Another plus is that there's plenty of neighborhood parking, without meters or time frames, which is super helpful when you don't want to get up every two hours just to move your car.
author: Knar K.

description:
Open early and closes late? Check (College Student plus)
Table/Chairs or super lazy soft couches? Check! (My butt hurts after sitting in one too long)
Bathroom clean? yeah!
Spacious Indeed! Probably 50 people could fit comfortably! CHECKK
I loved their Vanilla Chai and that white powdered sugar Russian Tea Cake.
Food and drinks seem fairly priced!
Good music.
Free WIFI.
Friendly service.

I'm lucky this is only 3 blocks from me :)
author: Lisa L.

description: My coffee place, i go there twice a day, early morning and after work and its always full of people casually sitting and chatting or doing homework students or young professionals talking on tech meetings, in other words it's a great place to have a own "Central Perk" in San Francisco
author: Grigori E.

description:
What more could you want out of an internet cafe?

Comfy sofas, many single tables for yourself and a friend, or just a whole table to yourself, cozy atmosphere, charming music, and a great menu with a bunch of tasty treats. I just moved into the neighborhood and I'm sure they're going to see much more of me soon!
author: Cara O.

description:
Cafe Enchante has a nice rustic, old world feeling about it. seating looks comfy with the sofas, benches. saw pastry counter with pastries, bagels, crossaints, and pirosky someheres.

pour: la columbe dark roast (Lg, 2)
-smooth with boldness, great coffee!
-notice one can get  up to 3 refills for 85 cents?

drips:
-nice older asian couple here
-$5 coffee/bacon egg muffin.
-regretted not buying anything  else
-until i saw meter person just a few cars from my car.  (meter just expired).
author: Victor G.

description: Found this hidden gem before catching the muni.  A family owned coffee shop that's clean, spacious, has free wifi, and a full menu of coffee and sandwiches.  What better way to spend my morning commute at this cafe just steps away from my muni stop.
author: Simon L.

description: Good people work here.  Great service and friendly.  Good selection of food and coffee was ok.  I like the environment and there was a diverse crowd.
author: Bucky W.

description:
Yep, the staff are nice enough, the red eye quite tasty and the room itself is quite spacious as pointed out by other reviewers.

This is certainly and rightfully a local gem but not a destination unless one has at least 2 other errands that bring you to this barrio.
author: Jay D.

description:
I really like Cafe Enchante. Aside from the convenience of it being just two blocks from my house, the service is really quick and the people that work there are very friendly. I unwittingly went in there once 10 minutes before close, realized it as the woman was making my drink, apologized to her for being one of "those" people, and received a very pleasant smile and conversation from her, saying she was happy to make my drinks. Sweet lass. There is one woman who is always there when I go in for my Iced Caramel Latte (which is delicious) and she's very difficult to understand. But fear not! Once you become a seasoned patron like myself, you will understand this woman and your past miscommunications will seem so far away.

Anyway, the food is pretty good and the portions are fairly large, especially for the price. My friend once got one of the smoothies and she has confirmed that it was very tasty.

The one downside to the place (if you want to eat in or drink your coffee on one of the many couches) is that the furniture has seen better days. Some of the couches look a tad on the dirty side and I've definitely changed my mind about seats that I've chosen because, well, who wants to sit on a dirty looking couch? Not this lady!
author: Stephenie S.

description: Best coffee shop around outer richmond. Coffee and sandwiches, cakes are good. Staffs are very friendly and place is very comfortable.  Love the jazz music that playels not too soft nor too loud. Love the place and best of luck to their business!
author: Stacy U.

description:
Mediocre coffee but for the most part good service 

The food is below mediocre and I was scolded for bringing in outside food despite purchasing a drink from them.

Plenty of study space, good wifi, tons of wifi, and new furniture.
author: Cara J.

description: Very cool coffeehouse with an awesome interior, cool jazz playing, and a piano. Outlets to charge up devices is very cool. Coffee is delicious and great selection of breakfast items
author: Dave G.

description:
I love it here. The coffee is always fresh. The main reason I go here is because you can get a large iced green tea for $2!
Starbucks always adds syrup to theirs even when you ask them not to. Enchante is far better than starbucks!
author: Ashley F.

description:
Staggered in at 9:00 AM jonesing for coffee. Super comfy place with couches, chairs, work tables with outlets and power strips everywhere. Excellent coffee and a really relaxing place. I could have easily fallen asleep. Good looking sandwiches and breakfast dishes. Good desserts.
Only negative was the stains on the fabric couches and chairs. Very good people watching place. I will return!!
author: Carol m.

description: It's only about time I give my favorite neighborhood cafe some Yelp love. I live in the area, and always come here when I need to get some work done. Its clean, spacious and has plenty of tables and outlets. WiFi is reliable. They don't play their music too loud (thank goodness).. Most importantly, I love their chai tea. I'm not much of a coffee person, but I've had plenty of teas from various cafes. Oprah Cinnamon Chai from Starbucks is definitely one of my top, but Cafe Enchante's Chai tea (Vanilla or spiced) is a true competitor. If you like chais--hands down,  you've got to try it here. Not into drinks? Their veggie sandwiches and bagels are pretty delicious too.
author: Christina L.

description: Decided I was going to get some coffee before I went to work and get some work done. Never been here, but I'll probably be back. Ordered a Vanilla Chai Latte, and its very yummy! I brought debit so beware 5$ is the minimum so I ordered an onion bagel with butter. It was good, but they did over do the butter. It was dripping off the bagel, so I had to slightly undress the butter from my bagel. Other than that, there is plenty of seating, and the barista was sweet. :)
author: Michelle C.

description:
Tea time tables.  Grand daddy desk.  Charger cord conundrum.

 "Bay clubuh wis abocado!"  Oh,that'd be me.  

College 'study buddies', softwareprenuers,  backpack bookies.  

Elderly sidewalk evangelist, "everybody loves me!"  

Still stalking my seat.  Sipping green tea.

My new office:)
author: Eric V.

description: This place has the worst service. The language they are speaking is not English for sure. I was barely understanding what was this old lady asking me. After I said "excuse me" for a couple of times this lady started repeating and shouting in that english of hers. I will never go here again.
author: Deepak S.

description: Coffee is not that good. They said it's free wifi and it took 15 minutes to load my email, super slow. Would not recommend for anyone who need high speed wifi or want to productively finish online works!
author: Tu Anh D.

description: An unpretentious, sunny place for an unpretentious, foggy neighborhood. I love that Café Enchanté serves simple, fresh fare (like their delicious avocado BLT) and only a small sampling of complicated coffee drinks (frappés and dessert-like beverages). Their dark roast is sublime, their snacks are a great range of savory & sweet, and the staff couldn't be friendlier. I'm enchanted and this will be my neighborhood spot as long as I live around the corner!
author: Linnie G.

description:
This is a great place to study.
The person who was working, who seemed to be the owner/manager, was very nice.
It wasn't crowded and the place was clean.
It has that Outer Richmond/Geary vibe if you know what I mean.
I liked it.
The drinks were good.
There's a sign that says it costs $2 to use the restroom if you're not buying anything.
I saw a piano in there and was tempted to play it.
I like how there were these 3 desks tucked away in the corner facing the wall. I sat there so I could really concentrate on something.

Bottom line--good coffee shop away from bustling SF.
author: Marlon T.

description: Chill, airy somewhat bohemian coffee shop in a neighborhood that doesn't have many other options. Cafe Enchante lets you fill up from the coffee thermos when you order a regular coffee. Relaxed atmosphere. My morning coffee and newspaper was only slightly marred by a schizophrenic woman who started rumbling through the cafe, fortunately the workers knew how to deal with her. I could see myself coming back if I lived in the area to get some reading or work done.
author: Michael C.

description: Great corner coffeeshop. Lots of seating and teas as well as Russian pastries (sweet and savory). Decorated in Parisian decor.
author: Susan B.

description:
A lot of cafes in San Francisco are small and a little cramped, just like the city itself. However, Cafe Enchante is expansive and comfortable. The walls are painted beautifully and it seems like there are plenty of places to sit.

I got a pretty simple snack: sesame bagel with avocado, cream cheese tomatoes. Done great, but, not hard to mess up.

Will definitely be back.
author: Sam D.

description: Charging more than what is in the board. The house coffee is almost empty while sold it without reminding anything plus dark stuff in the container which is very gross. Then my hubby was refused to use the restroom for not being the customer! Totally bad experience.
author: Winnie L.

description: Really nice, asian-american family owned, quiet coffee shop good for working. Cheap prices. Great coffee, and not this acidic third-wave bullshit either. A++++ would be productive here again.
author: Steve Y.

description:
There are not many cafes on Geary that are spacious with LOTS of tables/seats, but Enchante is one of them so you won't feel claustrophobic, cramped and nearly pushed up against someone else.  There are also many electrical outlets so you can work on your laptop.  There are also sofas if you want to be comfortable and talk to your friends there.   It kind of reminds me of a french cafe if you see the decor on the walls.   The noise level is quiet to medium.  Their bathroom is decent and usually well-stocked with soap/tissues/towels.

Their wi-fi has always been good when I've been there.  Unlike Peet's also on Geary, Enchante doesn't limit your wi-fi to 2 hours before you get the signal that you have to buy more stuff to get another code which limits to you to another 2 hour block of time. 

I love their bagel sandwiches (esp the Le Jardin Bagel) and regular sandwiches the best along with their smoothies, various coffees, and cold blended drinks.  They have a LIBRARY of just about any type of tea you would want.  I like non-bitter coffees which is another reason I hate Peet's.  I prefer Starbucks sweet coffees, but when comparing beverages and food selection/quality with Starbucks, I find Enchante on par with, if not better, than Starbucks.

The only thing to beware of is of the various pastries inside their glass counter.  I don't know where they get their various pastries, but sometimes, they can taste pretty off like the ground beef piroshkies.  Also, there is a $5 minimum to use your CC, but they do have an ATM inside.  

I wouldn't go out of my way to go to Enchante cafe, but if you're near Geary & 25th Ave, it's a great place to go to relax and use the wi-fi and get a good brunch or lunch esp since they open early 6am (7am on sundays) and close late 10pm (9pm mondays/sundays).
author: Frugal C.

description: Nice Euro style cafe with sweet treats and pretty good coffee. Their Espresso drinks are better than in Starbucks. Well, it is not just a tall order. Pleasant service and atmosphere too.
author: Alex G.

description: Great neighborhood gem and very nice owners and workers.  I've been coming here for years to do work on the laptop, free wifi and the food/drinks are affordable.  I usually stick with hot tea, ice mocha or chai... breakfast bagel or salmon sandwich and they are good.  The interior is nice with a parisian style and I learned that husband did most/all the murals.  The have a few sofa's and many small round tables (which can make it crammed) and recently added large community table.. plenty of outlets.  I do agree with a few reviews about bugs flying around which can be annoying but it doesn't stop me from coming back.
author: Patrick W.

description:
Very good coffee, nice service, average breakfast sandwich.
Big space, mixed crowd.
Upholstered furniture is dirty and looks gross.
author: Bert V.

description: I haven't been to Cafe Enchante for many years. It's been so long in fact that I forgot I  used to come here to study.  I stopped by today to get some reading in and it's exactly the same :) Same owners (I think) who were friendly and had smiles on their faces for me. I also love their plush seating choices.  I just wish you guys were closer to me but that's no fault of yours.  A+
author: Katherine P.

description: I was so impressed with this little place it's so clean on the inside and the food is delicious and fast I highly recommend the turkey and avocado sandwich. If I lived in the area this place would be my only stop for sandwiches.
author: Jessica K.

description: Our home away from home. Love this place. Want it to get good reviews, so that their business continues to do well. Don't want everyone (except the locals) overrunning the place.
author: Lineka D.

description:
It's not bad, it's not great. The coffee is scalding, the tuna melt was frozen in the middle but they do have ample seating, and free wi-fi, and lots of street parking. 

If you want to get some work done in a cafe, this place is alright.
author: Tatyana K.

description: To be fair, I haven't explored the menu beyond my usual hot chocolate or strawberry smoothie, but Cafe Enchante is a great place to go if you want to sit down and stay awhile. The couches make for a cozy spot to lounge with your laptop - or your friends - and in my experience, there's always seating available at the tables. The WiFi is fast enough to get work done and I've never felt pressure to leave before I'm finished. Enchante is the Geary Street's version of the "Friends" locale, Central Perk!
author: Vanessa D.

description:
For the UCB alum, while Cafe Enchante is no Cafe Milano and has a definite lack of freshly made salads and yummy red velvet cupcakes, their mocha is a definite thumbs up. 

So, if you're in need of a caffeine rush like a crack addict feels they need that hourly dosage of crack, look no further, Cafe Enchante has your back. 

PS - You won't need to fight for a table and even more importantly, there's enough room that you can sit a table away from any non-desirables (creepers, loud music players, etc). Happy studying!
author: Rebecca H.

description: I like this place! Cozy, warm, mellow non-obtrusive but groovy (seriously, it's like the 60s up in here) music, lots of seating (I'm in a Lazy-boy!), great sandwich (the "Golden Gate" with hot pastrami). No loud talkers. Clean bathroom. It's a great respite from the frigid temps outside. I never think to come out here because it always seems foggy and cold, but an unforeseen upside is that it's perfect for getting work done because you have no desire to be outside! I was just going to pop in for an hour or so but since they're open til 10pm, who knows?? I might be checking out the Outer Richmond more frequently...
author: Ms. E.

description:
$5 dollar minimum credit card purchase 

They have an ATM

TONS OF FLAVORS

breakfast sandwiches a plus!
author: Jorge D.

description:
BLT sandwich is great! Fresh lettuce +1.

Their Latte is better than Cafe au lait.
author: Alex S.

description:
I just moved in the Area and my neighbor told me about this place...VERY NICE!

I had the Ice Coffee and The Chicken Grilled Sandwich and my friend had Coffee with cinnamon and nutmeg with the Apple Strudel. 

Coffee Section is Great and the Chicken Grilled Sandwich was DELISH!

Strudel looked like it came out of a box, but my friend loved it.
author: Franziska G.

description:
We were going to go to Joe's for breakfast, but the line was WAAY too long and we needed coffee stat. Saw this place across the street and decided to stop in. 

First thing I noticed - the inside is WAY bigger than the facade lets in. The inside is very spacious with tons of seating, adorable paintings on the wall, free wi-fi, and awesome people. I immediately fell in love. 

They have a variety of coffee's to choose from, as well as a ton of bagels and breakfast sandwiches. I had a perfect Vanilla latte, and a plain wheat bagel with cream cheese, but I guarantee I'll be back here for more. It's the perfect place to sit, sip some coffee, and read a book or catch up on work. A must do if you're in the area.
author: Lauren D.

description:
Their ice coffee is just ok. It tastes like the coffee that I brew by myself. The wildberry cake is good. I like the atomosphere. It is good for studying or chatting. 
Nice coffee shop, but I like to try others next time.
author: Ted C.

description: One of the nicest cafes in San Francisco.  The owner put some care into this place.  Couches, nice European bistro tables, Wi-Fi, well-thought out decor, well-lit, lots of space, and even a (working) piano to boot.  Sizable drink menu with fair prices.
author: David S.

description:
Cool place. Lots of tables. Sweet couches and couple of desks. Very spacious. Nice food options with a mix of Russian piroshki, bagels and noodles. No background noise or loud music. Most ppl are working / reading 

But espresso is not great but much better than chains
author: Irina K.

description:
WHAT CAN I SAY... I'm a cafe dweller
(3.75 stars)

Have to appreciate good cafe's out there... sure beats Starbucks (sorry Mike if you're reading this, i'm just over your employer).

- Food, yum
- Coffee, meh decent
- Prices, affordable
- Service, good

I've been here on several occassions and all have been satisfying. Working from home can sometimes suck and a new scenary is needed. I'd take my work laptop and come here to get stuff done. It's away from the normal loud cafes, it's spacious and comfortable, FREE WIFI, and everybody here is either studying, browsing the internet, reading, or simply just sipping coffee.

HEFFER-STYLE STATUS.

CHICKEN SANDWICH/PANINI  ($7 -i think) - Wasn't sure exactly what was ordered. But one time my friend and I dropped in here to grab some sandwiches before a hiphop festival at Golden Gate Park. I wasn't expecting it to taste good but it turned out to taste REALLY GOOD.

LATTE ($2.50 - i think) - meh. had better. reminded me of gas station latte

PASTRIES - The pastries here are really good. I've had a few kinds and all have done me justice while sitting here slaving away behind my laptop.

Will I be back? I come here about twice a month to just get things done.
author: Jane A.

description:
I stumbled upon this cute Cafe in the Outer RIchmond while walking from the Golden Gate park to the Legion of Honor.

I was impressed with the quality of the food. I did not have high expectations since coffee shops tend to specialize in the drinks.

The chicken sandwich came on the freshest roll and packed lots of juicy chicken and veggies. 

The bagel enchante was pretty good too, but I recommend the sandwich.
author: Nina M.

description:
This is a nice, comfy, roomy, chill place to quietly hang out and do your coffee-drinking-web-surfing routine in the middle of the bustling city! 

You can enjoy a couch, table and chairs, even bring your own chess pieces to play on a chess board table. If you get hungry, buy a nibble from the counter. 

And if the internet is boring, you can watch Chinese families argue outside the picture window, both from May Flower on the corner or from Kirin Chinese Restaurant next door. 

Aiiyaaah!
author: Wanugee N.

description:
This is a great cafe. They have a lot of seating and they have spent a lot of time to make it feel homey. The paint job on the back wall is adorable and very inviting. There are three large couches as well, which is always a nice change from hard wooden cafe chairs. Pre-made snacks are delicious. (I had banana bread that was wrapped in saran wrap as well as a turnover type pastry filled with mushrooms and cheese; both were very tasty.) 

The only thing that is making me write a 3 star review instead of 5 stars is their use of the Executioner. (This is an electric bug swatter that looks like a tennis racket.) The Executioner definitely works (I know someone who uses this at home and it works like a charm), but it makes me avoid purchasing any of their pastries that aren't wrapped in plastic wrap or anything they have to prep on the counters. They wave the device right over the unwrapped pastries to zap any flies that have gotten into the pastry display. Yes, it's better to have a zapped fly than one that is alive on your food, but the idea of powdered zapped bug all over a croissant isn't very appealing either. I assume they are coming in through the door that is left open (probably for ventilation since the large picture windows don't open). If they could just keep that door closed, they would probably not have to use the bug zapper. It emits a loud zapping noise too, which is distracting, especially when you realize what is going on.

I hope they read this because I think it's an easy remedy to fix by shutting the door. The staff there have all been very pleasant and I have seen them cleaning the tables off when they are vacant, so they strive to keep the cafe sanitary and clean.

(I just realized that I had already posted a review before with 4 stars but wanted to downgrade to 3 stars since I recently saw them wave the zapper directly over the pastries.)
author: Judith D.

description:
Could have been five stars except for the non-free WiFi. The good-sized blended mocha (not too sweet, not too bitter) hits the spot on a hot day.

Overall a nice atmosphere, what with the French-themed murals and friendly staff. This place feels cozy due to the layout; two separate rooms with small chairs and tables. You can go in a group, but there's really no big-group seating.

Plus, the infamous Geary Avenue parking. Yet, I will still return.
author: Peter L.

description: I ordered the Big E with ham and Swiss cheese and a hot apple cider. Cost about $8. It was well worth it, great sandwich and the cider was delicious. Be careful with any hot drink. They make them quite hot, so it could stand to cool off for a few before sipping.
author: DeAnna U.

description:
I might be biased because I only live one block away but this is my new favorite study spot! There are plenty of outlets and tables around so you'll probably have no probably finding a place to sit. There are also some couches for you to hang out at. I have noticed that some people come to just meet up with people for conversations too. That's usually fine because there's enough room in this cafe for you to distance yourself from people who may be distracting. 

The coffee is fine for a neighborhood cafe. I'm simple with my coffee. I just get a small iced coffee, no milk with vanilla flavoring. A little less than $2.50 and I'm set for a long day of studying!
author: Connie Y.

description:
A cute Parisian inspired cafe!  

Besides being on the way to the Planet Granite climbing gym, there are a lot of things to love about Cafe Enchante.  It's the perfect little cafe/coffee house to get some serious studying done.  If laptops at coffee houses annoy you and you long for the days when people went to places like this to chat it up, then this isn't your place.  Everyone here is working away on their computers.  

That being said, this is the place to be if you need to get out of the house to get some work done.  They have a free wi-fi connection with none of those silly time limit rules, plenty of open spaces and tables for you to set up a workstation (or a few couches if you just want to get comfty), the coffee and sandwiches are tasty and affordable, the ambiance here is nice with the European touches, and the music is soft and unobtrusive.  Also, compared to most coffee houses in SF, it's a good size, and the layout is such that you don't feel cramped or overcrowded.
author: Lisa N.

description:
Mona Lisa makes me smile. This is their vegetarian sandwich piled high with sprouts, pepperoncini, red onions, roasted bell peppers, cucumbers, tomatoes, cheese of your choice inside bread of your choice. A couple times, I think during training a new hire, they put avocado in it.. I'd order it with the sandwich any day. I usually get the sandwich with provolone cheese on rye bread that is nicely toasted. I come here for the sandwich a lot, even skipping the coffee sometimes. Turkey wrap is good too but they could use better quality turkey and maybe provolone or instead of I think American that isn't that great with the hummus.

Coffee is decent, not sure how often they change the dispensers but haven't had terribly burnt coffee from them. Get their chai since they use Big Train which is sooo good dirty (w/ a shot of espresso). Big Train is more like a sweet chai powder rather than a chai tea concentrate.. so don't expect the latter. It's the same brand used at Nordstrom espresso bars, which is delicious and they often sell it there.

It's a good space to study, lots of outlets and tables and big windows for natural lighting. All the good sandwiches/food/coffee/beverages can fuel you for hours, even all day. I just wish they were open late to serve all the students living in the Outer RIchmond. I'm not one anymore but it sure would've helped when I was. Also, beware parking.. This place is best to walk or bus too since meter parking is expensive and hard to find, unless you score a residential spot on 26th. Another plus is after a day of studying you can walk across to Tradr Sams for your reward. :)
author: Rachelle F.

description:
It was one of those days... you know the ones.... its 2pm, your morning coffee has worn off and you're convinced that if anyone could see through your makeup into your soul, you'd look like something resembling the Walking Dead. 

no Starbucks or Peets in sight for 20 blocks..... so I decided to give this place a try. The interior is suuper cozy, and much larger than you'd think standing outside looking in! But on to the drink... I got a caramel latte, and crossed my fingers that it wouldn't be sickeningly sweet. She rang me up for something like 4 bucks (for a small!) and since all i had was a debit card, and they only accept those with $5 charges.. I grabbed a slice of banana bread. .... which was like another $3. 

Basically... the 4 stars includes interior, the vibe, the speed, and the taste of the latte which was BOMB. knocked a star off for the price.. for crying out loud, they're not some cute little hip shop in the middle of Financial District.
author: Alana V.

description:
I think I must have ordered the wrong drink (white chocolate mocha) because it was super sweet and kind of artificial tasting.  The chocolate chip cookie could have also used 25% more chips to get to an appropriate chip to dough ratio (not a generous one, but an acceptable one).  

The other experience that made it 2* instead of 4* was that ... a crazy lady came in from the street and started berating me!  Total stranger, clearly not with it.  The cashier came over and shooed her away after a few minutes, but it was the longest few minutes of my life!  

I did like that there were plenty of tables, plenty of power strips, and free wifi.
author: Olivia L.

description:
I came here to meet my friend while she's studying away for her midterm. I'm glad she introduced me here. I absolutely love the interior of this cafe! The French themed mural takes you to a whole different place. Very nice and relaxing cafe, with tons of couches and cute tables.

Had three pots of jasmine green tea, a grilled cheese sandwich, and an absolutely delicious french soda :)
author: Linda L.

description:
Cafe Enchante has become my favorite cafe/coffee spot in my neighborhood.  In looking for a good place to work that gets me out of the house, this place has it all!  So far, everything I have tried has been great.  Whether it is a simple cup of iced coffee, a hot chai, or even apple cider, I have been happy! Finding a good cup of coffee in Outer Richmond can be touch-and-go, and this place is a go, Go, GO!  Enchante's foods and treats are also awesome!  I have tried sandwiches and wraps, and am gearing up to test some of the most "authentic" euro-themed treats.  

Now, most important for me on a weekday is, can I work here?  The answer is a super-loud YES!!!! Cafe Enchante has free Wifi that actually works!!! I can even *gasp* open more than one webpage or play a video if need be!  In addition, there are plugs EVERYWHERE!  Grab a spot on one of the couches and put your feet up, snuggle in at a table for two, or partner up at one of the larger tables!  Also, the music isn't blaring or distracting.

Basically, this place has it all!  And what's great, is the ambience doesn't come with a huge price-tag.  I love it so much I stop by on the weekends just to grab food or read a book.  Woohoo!!!  Thanks for existing in my side of town!
author: Sara W.

description:
ambiance was nice.  great to study, people watch, or group meetings.  open till 10pm as well for the late studiers.

drinks.....hmm I mistakenly ordered a vanilla chai, which they use powder.  it was not mixed well and the undissolved particles slowly collected on the bottom of my cup.  
i was not even able to drink 1/6 of it...

maybe next time ill get a cup of tea.  tea bags shouldnt be bad.
author: Linda T.

description:
great study spot with lots of tables and outlets. 

dirty chai and hummus veggie bagel was delicious.

staff is nice and welcoming
author: Nicki B.

description: This place is cool. A good study spot I guess. They have a good array of items and drinks but their food isn't something you crave or really want to run to either. It's more of a convenient neighborhood spot to grab a quick bite. It's just an average place really, worth a try.
author: Anonymous ?.

description: Hummus veggie wrap was alright. coffee is hard to mess up. but i loved the couches and chairs and overall great environment for reading...lovely
author: Alexandra R.

description: This review is for the chai latte: bomb. I mean, wow this is the creamiest most flavorful chai I've ever had at a cafe/coffee place. Thank you!
author: Cristina F.

description: Potentially my fav cafe in the Richmond! Nice and spacious, quaint European-esque decor, comfortable seating choices, friendly service, original menu. Excellent place to grab a satisfying bite and chill with a laptop for an hour or two.
author: Brook R.

description:
Enchanting.

Nice trick creating a Parisian themed cafe in what is often one of the foggiest parts of the city. Murals and fountains certainly add a whimsical touch.

Likely holdovers from the previous Euro Cafe incarnation. Ambiance of course can only go so far. Enchante needed to deliver on everything else.

They do.

Excellent coffee. One of my favorite cafe caffinations. Yes I just made the word up. Smooth and potent. Americano is less than three bucks includes your choice of syrup.

Morning bites range from bagel creations to granola. No parfait available but you can build your own cheaper than elsewhere.

Lunch warrants another use of the word excellent.

Plan was to take a sandwich bite, do some email, sandwich bite, email, etc. Turkey, veggies and hummus on wheat got my undivided attention till the very end.

Happened on a comfy couch. With WiFi. Plenty of outlets nearby. Huge windows are a reminder of what outside looks like.

Often it's enchanting fog inside a rather enchanting cafe.
author: Jason B.

description:
Cafe Enchante: it's becoming a second home for me. I don't care what people think of me vegging out on the couches. This is my chill out spot for me time.

They play good music. No teenage baristas playing Lady Gaga on their iPhones over the speakers here.

F*ck yeah, free wifi! It's decent! Seriously, I tell all out-of-towners (couchsurfers, hitchhikers, the travelers who aren't tourists) to come to this place when they need to rest their feet and figure out their itinerary.

The coffee is not decadent, but decent for the price. Hey, it's cheaper than Starbucks by a dollar or two. F*ck it. 50 cent refills all day!? That makes it worth not buying a large if you're not sure you can handle the caffeine. Also on that note, the food is good. They make the sandwiches when you order them. Again, cheaper than Starbucks with more options.

I like the plaaaaants. I like the faux European cafe atmospheeere. I like the cookiiiiiies.

The bathroom is a bitch to get into. I'm not a fan of that. You need a decent bathroom at a coffee shop. At least it's unisex?
author: Sterling D.

description: (deep sigh)... I was studying..  All of a sudden these two workers started asking me if I purchased  something.. I was going to buy something later on bt these two kept coming and asking me to buy something right away ..  I had been there for only like 20 mins.. Come on man!  Been there many times but was the first time this kinda shit happened .. made me upset n was huge turn off.. It should be up to customers when to buy food or drink..right? esp at the cafe..  They were keep saying that if ppl don't buy anything while merely using free wifi, then their business won't be successful. I was like DUH..totally understandable. But from my point of view, even those who don't buy anything but come just for the use of the internet might turn to be a positive influence and ultimately boost the sales of the store. For instance, what if those guys recommend this place to their friends for a studying place, or what if they write the positive reviews on Yelp which would be seen by many other ppl. They might not be buying anything at your store at the moment in a particular day, but they are bringing more customers in a long run. Business is all about word-of-mouth. Look at me, although I was really a fan of this place and used to recommend here for my friends and even wrote a positive review on Yelp the other day, now I'm writing a negative review and won't recommend to nobody!  Alrit ima off to Starbucks.
author: Ryoji T.

description:
One of the best neighborhood cafes ever. LOTS of seating to accommodate any sized group or just you and your computer/book/thoughts. They have 6 different types of coffee (decaf, light, medium, and dark roasts as well as a hazelnut delight and a french vanilla). 
You may need to take a minute to decide what you want to eat because they have such a long list of options !! The breakfast croissant is amazing, as well as all of their bagel sandwiches. Im also a sucker for their panini pressed sandwiches. Great smoothies as well!
author: Sara S.

description: Decent espresso, nothing special.  Clearly a place for those who enjoy 'chilling' at coffee shops, as the place was packed at around 7pm on a mid-week evening.  I'm not a coffee shop 'chiller', but I enjoyed the convenience of this place none-the-less, and I'll be back from time to time when in the area...
author: Andy S.

description: Very quaint and charming cafe. Nice staff with good coffee and decent breakfast food items.
author: Edwin S.

description: I came here a few times and it's a cute, quiet coffee shop. Lots of seating and people busy studying or on there laptop or tablets. They have coffee and a variety of espressos, pastries, bagels, and sandwiches. I ordered a Caramel Macchiatto and it tasted good, but maybe I should of ordered an extra shot espresso to make it perfect. One time during lunch I ordered a made to order toasted turkey sandwich and it was hot and pretty tasty.
author: Anna P.

description:
Ordered a macchiato and they served it up in a 10 or 12oz mug brimming with foam.  This is not a macchiato...I mean yeah I guess its espresso and foam, but it should be like 3 or 4 sips.  A star for effort I guess.

Interior is nice though...
author: James Y.

description: Have yet to find a better cup of hot chocolate then right here at this cafe :) I order it all the time. I've had the BLT here and it's good, it is thin straps and probably microwaved but I wouldn't expect much else from a cafe, the sandwich is still tasty. This place is great to sit and study, and has a calm environment! Only complaint I would have is I feel they could use just a few more outlet or extension plugs in a few areas to make it easier but usually I'm able to find a spot near an outlet
author: Terilyn T.

description: Quiet, layed back coffee shop with plenty of room, polite and fast service. Pastry selection was limited. The coffee skill required to understand what you're ordering is medium to high. I'm no coffee aficionado,  so I ordered some strange coffee concoctions that was bitter. Overall nice.
author: Michael G.

description: Friendly, low key place. Relaxing music. Nice mix of people- looks like everybody belongs here!
author: Mary M.

description:
Ever since I've moved back from Berkeley, I've had trouble trying to find a place to go to whenever I needed to study. While there are plenty of cafes in the area, this is probably the best place to go to if you need to get your study on in the Richmond district.

With free wifi, plenty of tables as well as couches to lay, you really can't complain about this place. After my four years at Cal, I've been so used to trying to compete for a space at a cafe that it's actually kind of strange being back at a cafe where there's always going to be a spot available. 

Also. There are lots of outlets available. *GASP*! 

I have bittersweet memories with this place as, I spent almost everyday here during the summer while I studied for the MCAT. blah. 

Their coffee isn't bad though I didn't really like the strawberry smoothie. It was pretty watered down.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
This little cafe The Richmond epitomises what one would expect of a typical San Francisco style cafe:

A nice selection of coffee, baked goods, bagels, and warm sandwiches
Furniture for every occasion! (couches, coffee tables, armchairs, four-seaters, two-seaters)
Free WiFi
Kind and relaxed staff
Good crowd
Quiet enough to study or do work on the weekends

Couldn't ask for much more of a coffee shop!
author: Victor R.

description:
PROS
- The best part about this cafe is the layout. It's really big with several different sections that you can sit in. Also lots of different seating arrangements from couches to stools and high tables to individual cafe tables to desks. 
- The cafe has a lot of drink and food options. I've only ever gotten coffee so I can't really speak to the quality of the other items. 
- The staff is friendly and helpful.

CONS
- The worst part about this cafe is the internet connection. I had to leave after 30 minutes because I couldn't get online and that was really the only reason I was there.


Enchante is a great place to come if you're planning to meet a friend and chat or if you want to read a book or do a crossword in a relaxing place. However, if you are going to a cafe to use your laptop, forget this cafe. Unfortunately, because this is my sole reason for going to cafes at the moment, I won't be coming back anytime soon...
author: Car C.

description:
Trying to wrap up my thesis has made me a proud cafe worker. This is one of my favorite study spots. It's decorated in a really tacky way and it makes me feel cozy. Let me list all the positives for you:

1. It has a million places to sit and plenty of outlets, I don't think I have ever come here and wasn't able to find a place to work, even on the weekends!

2. Large windows make me feel less like a prisoner

3. The food is actually pretty good for a cafe, I really like their Mona Lisa sandwich which is packed with veggies and is delicious

4. The customer service is usually good. a handful of times I've experienced so-so service from one young girl but usually that is not the case. 

5. They don't try to kick your ass when you sit there all day working

6. It's big so I don't feel trapped or like someone is constantly hovering over my shoulder

The only thing I wish was different was their hours...I work late and I'd love to be able to stay here beyond their closing time. But I guess some people like to sleep. Oh well.
author: Vanessa T.

description:
AWESOME spot to study, look at your mail or surf the net.

There's a lot of seats, a whole bunch of outlets and free WiFi! YES!

It's also really cozy in there. 

I got a BLT sandwich and a white chocolate mocha.  Both were good. I especially liked the mocha though! Grade A.
author: Marisa R.

description: This cafe will always hold a dear place in my heart! I'm here whenever I need to get some work done on my laptop and I adore sitting in the corner by the window, listening to the pleasant french or classical music in the background with a veggie sandwich and hot cup of mango tea. The atmosphere and decor take me back to Paris. The staff is always really friendly as well.
author: Marina A.

description:
There, I feel like home! The owner is very nice, wonderful people! 
My favorite sandwich : the Golden gate! 

Delicious!!! 
A place to visit for sure!
author: David A.

description: I wish we had more coffee shops like this in Los Angeles. I'm usually drinking either a double cappuccino or black coffee (sometimes sweetened). Their drips are served in big thermos dispensers (the kind you'd take to an outdoor event or picnic) so if you order a regular coffee, they're only going to hand you a cup. They have brown sugar which, IMO, is better than any other sweetener. The brew is strong and flavorful. Last time I got an amazing cappuccino which I swear I can still taste. The environment is very relaxed with plenty of seating. It reminds me an old library. We scored and sat on the couch, which probably could have been cleaner, but hey, it was still comfortable.
author: Armen H.

description:
I don't particularly like the look of the food that is served. 
The couches are a little dirty looking.
Sometimes it gets a little too crowded/stuffy but clears out eventually.

But the hazelnut coffee is good.
The place is not expensive.
