There is a ton of room and tables for you to get lost in your studies in.
It's a neighborhood gem, not your blue bottle. 

Just don't come here and bum off their wi-fi. I see you. I'm always there and I will kick your chair. Buy something you cheapo.
author: Jane T.

description:
This coffee house changes names & ownership all the time.  Café Enchante doesn't seem that different from its predecessor, Euro Café, though it looks nicer now that they've painted a French street scene on the walls and added an indoor fountain (a little odd).  They also added some fake plants and replaced most of the furniture.  They kept the free wi-fi, ample number of power outlets, leather couches, bathroom and the ATM.  The wooden chairs aren't padded but they're not that uncomfortable.  

The menu seems similar (sandwiches, bagels) and the pastry and deli cases seem to hold the same items it used to (e.g., piroshky, cake, croissants).  The sandwiches didn't look bad.

The latte is good ($3.25 for a medium).  I wouldn't say it's amazing but it's solid (could use more foam/milk), fairly strong and not too bitter/burnt.  

The morning crowd seemed older and Russian.  One guy with a long beard and flowing black robe was probably a Russian priest from the church across the street.  Later the laptop crowd appeared.  The atmosphere is relaxed and quiet - good for work - plus some interesting characters show up.  I'm usually able to find unlimited free parking in the area (side streets).
author: Lolia S.

description:
Many a study dates here with friends and the boyfriend. A cute little place in the neighborhood. When you order custom drinks and the owners wife (small Vietnamese lady) works the bar, make sure you wait for your drink because she is so hard to understand! 
Anyways, wifi signal is great. Lots of seating. They have an ATM if you don't have cash!
author: Deanna B.

description: I stopped in here for a quick bite on a Saturday morning and got the impression the community likes this cafe a lot. Folks were doing work, studying, reading, browsing, relaxing, etc. It seems well-loved and frequented. I got a latte and a pirozhok so I hung around while they heated the food. The women who prepared the order were pleasant and quick. I can definitely see myself stopping here again.
author: Yolanda Y.

description: A very Euro feeling cafe with good coffee and lots of different snack good too, free wifi as well. I like the couches too, cool spot.
author: Christopher Steven O.

description:
I'm at Cafe Enchante at least 1-2x a week since I work from home and only go to my office 1x a week. While I've been laying off coffee and caffeine for health reasons, I still frequent this place SO often for a nice calm place to work at.

The owners are great, I love the lady there she is sweet and cute and makes the BEST mocha's, I always look for her when I come in since her drinks are the best.

The other girls I've had at the counter are super cool too,  it's a great laid back spot with a nice ambiance, speakers with jazzy-alt music, a little waterfall, some plants and pretty murals on the wall that make you feel like you're in a European cafe (I've been to Europe, I can say this honestly).

My favorite thing to get? An iced mocha (or iced green tea) and a BLT. But the bagels are good and so is the Ham and Swiss cheese sandwich on rye/wheat.  What I like is that there is free wi-fi and you can sit for over 4 hours without them kicking you out or getting made you are using their plugs (my computer dies quick!) Plus there are chairs with tables, a few desks, fridges full of soda and juice and some sofas to sit and relax in too. The only thing I'm not a fan of is how you can obviously see a lot of people sitting and working/studying and some people give their kids free reign of the place to run around and scream. I understand you have kids but if you see it's silent inside, go away or at least get your drink and tell your kids to be quiet. 

Anyway, great place, I love it!
author: Diana R.

description:
THIS is what I'm looking for in a coffee shop!  Comfy couches, tasty coffee and treats, beautiful murals in a cozy, put-your-feet up atmosphere.  I love this place to study, journal, or meet pals.  The owners are also very kind and are involved in the cafe.  

So why not 5 stars?  It's kind of a pain to get to if you don't live in the Richmond and you take public transportation.  I would LOVE it if the owners would open a similar cafe in the Sunset. (hint hint, pretty please!)
author: Stephanie S.

description: Super cute cafe with a decent menu. The owners hardly speak English but it's cool because you somehow understand them and all the goodies are delicious. The only reason I give this place 3 stars is because one of the male owners/employees kept staring at me like I was stealing or something after I came out of the restroom. He suspiciously eyed me for about 13 minutes (I kept track) while I sat and did nothing. Made me feel uncomfortable. Good thing I'm only visiting town.
author: Auriel D.

description:
Thanks to Yelp, I came upon this charming hint-of-Euro-Disney-meets Friends' Central Perk cafe (the D-word might invoke a negative image to some, but it really is a comfy). This place is relaxing with large couches, a nice array of tables and chairs, lots of elbow room and a calming fountain.

Good selection of savories and sweets - piroshkis, sandwiches, bagels, etc. Muffins, cookies, strudels - really good apple-brandy cake, coffees & teas.

Friendly, neighborhood vibe - a good, casual place to study or catch up. Large windows to observe the Kingdom of Geary.
author: Cathy K.

description:
I like this place. But, for those of you with a keenly developed sense of coffeeshop vibe, it feels more like a downtown-SF corporate style place than a homey, local, college style place. For that reason, I only come here when I'm seeking that. There are definitely alternatives in the neighborhood. 

As far as the actual comestibles go: the coffee is cheap and good-ish, although the staff always seems to get a bit disoriented, and the carafes are often empty. Pastries are so-so and best left unpurchased.
author: Michael B.

description:
I love this place ,  and overall it's a great place to study. It's chill, large, and full of seating and outlets. I'm no caffeine connoisseur, but every drink I've had here has been good. The food is also pretty good if basic, sandwiches and the like. It tends to be busy on weekends, so get there early if you're planning on studying.

In the negatives, it does have a $5 minimum for cards, but there's a grocery 1 block away that gives cash-back. The internet can also be slow and spotty, so it's probably best not to work on projects that require fast reliable internet here.

Other than that, I would strongly recommend this place to anyone in the neighborhood. It's the best cafe for working in that I've found in the Richmond or even the city.
author: Ned D.

description:
pros: hidden gem in inner richmond near the beautiful seacliff/china beach, lots of space, really quiet, really good hot spiced chai tea

cons: the english muffin with egg, turkey, and cheese was bland and nothing to write home about. 

this is my new study spot. huge fan.
author: Siva M.

description:
Amazing coffee, delicious food, friendly staff and cool atmosphere.
They make great caramel macchiatos and mochas...they're my favorite bc they don't taste syrupy like starbucks drinks do!

Food !!! the mona lisa is ssoooo good. and so are the bagel sandwiches. they do a great job and i have to say, the mona lisa with hummus is my favorite vege sandwich! 

the staff is super friendly!  today, they didn't make me pay extra for hummus bc i opted out of cheese. i usually get charged extra even when i subtract things from the sandwich at other places. 

the cafe is spacious with couches and cute round tables. i like the french themed wall paintings too.

you should definitely check this place out if you haven't yet.
author: Katherine C.

description: Lots of tables and couch options to camp out and hit the books for schoolwork. Very cool wall paintings too. A major plus for me is that it's near my apartment. There are so many outlets within distance of all tables.
author: Zard A.

description: I gave this spot four stars because you can really get some work done here. That said, it's not a cafe in the usual sense of the word. Sure, they serve coffee, they have those plastic wrapped pastries that seem to last forever. BUt last night, (Saturday, Nov. 22, 2014, I happened in here because I wanted to chill sans booze for a moment. Yikes. It was like that scene from Stardust Memories where Woody Allen gets on the wrong train, looks out of the window, only to see the then unknown Sharon Stone blowing him a kiss from the train on the adjacent track. So Allen gets up and tries to get off his train and onto that one. Only to find that he barely misses doing so as the trains pick up speed. Great for working. Do not come alone unless you are on deadline.
author: Michael W.

description:
I dwelled here during my days of unemployment.  Staff was always friendly and accommodating.

This place has a good buzz and is a comfortable place to hang out.  I'm not accustomed to talking to strangers in coffee shops, but I met some cool people here.
author: John B.

description:
This neighborhood haunt is roomy and sometimes busy, but it's good for socializing, reading a book, or browsing the web with the WiFi. Believe it or not, before it was even bigger - but the current size is just about perfect.

Too often, the espresso drinks are somewhat bitter - a warning sign of inexpensive coffee beans. Drink a latte or macchiato here if you're not picky about taste.

The eclectic selection of edibles will have something for just about anybody. The interior is adequately lit, and the faux French wall decorations make it roomy and inviting. There's three couches...and even a small fountain.
author: Thirsty C.

description: I LOVE this place, the staff are so friendly and always greet me warmly. I get the BLT or Bay Club on sourdough bread and they're both delicious - generously filled and yum. I come here pretty often to work and on weekends for lunch, and spend a lot of time in the cafe as it's homey and comfortable. Free Wifi is a plus too :)
author: Meg D.

description:
Studying has always been a struggle for me, I have never really liked school but the reason i keep at it is I know that i need my degree in order to climb the ladder even higher. I never really developed good study habits but i find that i get more done when i am out of the house and at a cafe or the library. Cafe Enchante's location has changed ownership many times and i hope Enchante will be here to stay. They have decent coffee and drinks, lots of tables and free wifi! Cafe Enchante is very spacious and super clean. 

I recently started going here to study and find that it is a very good place to study since majority of the people in here are studying. You will find me here at nite, studying away or tapping on my laptop.
author: Jonathan W.

description:
I've been stopping in here on occasion for a while now (at least the last three name changes), and I love the new look.  The tables are painted and decoupaged to go with the new theme, and the mural is georgeous!  There are many small tables and chairs and a few big comfy couches and armchairs.

The coffee is as good as any other cafe, and they have bagels, sandwiches, cake, cookies, soup, and sweet and savory pastries.

WiFi and a few computers as well.
author: Miriam G.

description: Very chill atmosphere and music isn't so loud that it's bothersome. Their coffee is great and affordable and it's not your typical Starbucks that want to get you out the door unless you buy more of their stuff. I study here often and they offer free wifi to anyone who buys something off their menu.
author: Moses D.

description: Plenty outlets! A few coffee shops in the area either do not have working outlets or do not have enough. It's very spacious with different sitting options. And the coffee is pretty good too!
author: Morgan A.

description:
Sorry guys but I have to give you 3 stars, here is why, I ordered a macchiato which I never ordered before, the girl told me it's going to be a shot of espresso with foam and I assumed that is what goes into a plastic cup of different sizes but it came in just one very small coffee cup ( not plastic), what i really wanted is a coffee drink in plastic cup medium size, so I told her I'm sorry I guess I didn't understand you correctly can I order something else? she said sure, so I ordered another drink and she charged me for 2 items. I don't think starbucks or peets coffee would have an issue with substituting free of charge, well not at this place, girl said sorry I can't take it back ... O_O why not?? is it going to be a huge loss in money value to you? well you definitely just lost a customer. One more thing, their spinach turnovers are sooo greasy I could only eat half which I regretted later. The variety of food offered was almost gone when I got there by around 3:30pm, it had bunch of price sticks without much food left to offer.
The place itself is not bad, very specious and have nice soft couches, not crowded and the music is not loud, i liked it and if not for the service I'd come here more often.
author: Natalia A.

description: Wow.  I really wished I lived closer to Cafe Enchante, namely for the reason of how open this place is for working/studying -- in fact, there were probably 25 people in there this afternoon, and it was nearly completely silent, and low music was in the background.  Amazing!  It's a student's dream to find a cozy, quiet cafe like this.  The coffee is good, too.  Hopefully I'll be able to come back sometime soon.
author: Mel G.

description:
Hey Buster K, her name is Briget. I asked because it was awesome being treated so warmly and attentively. I felt I should give praise where it is deserved. I'll go out of my way to grab a latte if I see she's working.]

The internet service is always working for me. It's too bad that one time someone came on an off night. Whoever you are, you might give Enchante another shot?

The coffee is great, as is the food. After trying the pastries a number of times, I say they're okay to pretty good (not great). In fairness, I come at night when the pastries may not be fresh. 

I LOVE the business hours and tables with room to really get to work. That's worth four stars. Briget earns the fifth. They will serve me latte's until the very last minute they're open and I love that! These are the main reasons that I come 1-3 times a week.
author: S S.

description:
I've been coming here 4 days now and it's truly is wonderful.  They staff is very sweet and makes a decent vanilla soy cafe au lait.  It's sounds very LA but at the same time let me clarify I'm lactose intolerant and espresso gets me a little jittery.

The couches and heat are worth it alone but the faint pleasant music is an added bonus.
author: Ashley I.

description:
This is one of those places that you wonder why you have never come to before.  It's spacious, clean, quiet and friendly. And there is free wifi.   The coffee here is very good, and the veggie bagel i had definitely hit the spot. 
With the French Cafe album playing the background, really how can you go wrong.  The girls behind the counter are super friendly and the pastries looked really good too, even the vegan ones, which is usually an oxymoron.  Tasty Looking=Vegan?  Not in my book.    

Nothing goes better with coffee and a bagel than a little Georges Brassens, am I wrong, dude? Am I wrong?

The couches and big comfy, CLEAN armchairs definitely make this a place to come back to.  There are plenty of outlets and you get an interesting crowd.  Job hunters like me, older retired guys, and even the neighborhood Russian Orthodox priest.

I'll definitely be coming back to this place.
author: Adam E.

description: Great place for working.  The coffee isn't single origin or anything but they make it rich.
author: Bob O.

description: The cutest coffee shop! Plenty of space, great to relax and study or read. Great coffee too!
author: Arye R.

description:
Decent cafe, especially to work.  Large and open.

Lots of seating of various types (wooden chairs, couches, and even saw a comfy office chair) and tables (including a desk, in front of that comfy chair).  

Good tea selection but haven't tried their coffee.  They had a good amount of pastries and quick bites.   Waitress was cute but apparently not enough to compensate for her rudeness that my friends experienced.  Maybe she was just having a bad day?

Plenty of metered parking near by at night.

Downside (to some)  is it closes at 10.  Upside... there's Trad'r Sam's across the street for after work/study drinks.
author: Young K.

description: I was expecting a crowd in the late afternoon but there's plenty of seating available. It's a little impersonal (the employee working that day started mopping around my seat soon after I got my order), dark, and the hot chocolate was the powdered kind.
author: Ericka V.

description: Greatest place every.  I always forget the wifi password, but the staff always reminds me what it is.  Plain understandable english. Not that hard to decipher " SanFrancisco". =)
author: Daniel C.

description: Quite nice, honestly. I Iike how they painted the place. They have nice sandwiches too. I deducted 1 star because they always forget to refill the coffee and milk containers.
author: Juliana B.

description:
The first time I came here, the lady at the counter worked really slowly. Perhaps it counts as being very 'thorough' but I guess I'm more used to the fast-paced Starbucks service when they herd your through the shop. 

The coffee was okay (if it was soley based on coffee, I'd give it 3 stars) but what did it for me for the tiny cafe was the decor. I absolutely love how the cafe is set up. You have to come here to see. There are sofas, couches, tables, desks, etc... so whatever setting you want to relax in, they've got it. And it's free wifi. Extra points for those who just want a nice local cafe to go study.
author: Andy C.

description:
Cute, corner coffee shop in the outer Richmond area
Hangout for students; there is a Wi-fi connection
Good coffee/non-coffee drinks
Bagel and regular sandwiches; loved the Enchante bagel with cream cheese, turkey, and apple
Cool French/European motif
Small tables and lounge chairs
Friendly service
Clean bathrooms
author: Rosquete B.

description: Don't know much about the in-cafe atmosphere itself because I always take my coffee and breakfast sammies to go, but two words, "Big. E."  ok, maybe four: "Big. E with Bacon." Affordable and yummy breakfast egg muffin sammies.
author: Geralyn Y.

description: Best dirty chai latte I've had in the city hands-down. If you have a lot of work to get done or just wanna kick back and catch up with friends, this is the best place to go. The owners are adorable and sweet. I wouldn't want to give anyone else my money.
author: Stefani R.

description: Quiet, good music , descent coffee, wifi, good morning SF.
author: Gerry F.

description:
Major plusses: 
* Abundant all-day (not even 2-hour) street parking, power outlets and wifi
* Super friendly staff
* Inexpensive menu items (I got a chicken sandwich for around $6)
( Plenty of spots to camp out for long periods of time to get your work done

On the not-so-plus side:
* Out of the way if you usually do biz downtown or in SOMA
* A bit "homey" on the furniture side...as in, not sure what other creatures may be camping out in the musty couches with you
* Food is worth exactly what you pay for it if not less (not even dark green lettuce with the sandwich and no accompanying salad or fries)

But they are so nice and it's so easy being here that I have to be this way and get some work done, I'll definitely consider returning.
author: Diane B.

description:
I decided to stop by here because it was 20 minutes until the next 29 bus towards home, and I was freezing and a bit hungry too. I ordered a hot apple cider, then kicked myself mentally right afterward because according to most coffee places, apple cider means "pour some apple juice into a cup and microwave it". 

So there I was, regretting my decision of ordering something that's already kind of unpopular and also out of season. I took my first sip. I wasn't expecting warm, almost creamy appley goodness in the cup. I opened the lid and looked in: three WHOLE cinnamon sticks at the bottom! DAMN GURL!! Also, I swear they put caramel in too, but I didn't see any.

The interior looks really nice. Comfy chairs, couches, and looked more like a big living room than a cramped chain coffee shop. I'll be back to enjoy it more when I'm not completely burned out from work.
author: Tiffany C.

description: We came here because we were visiting the Holy Virgin Cathedral across the street. There were a lot of signs up that suggest that the average customer is perhaps not thoughtful - signs about bathrooms being for paying customers only, signs about refills, and etiquette, etc. I can't remember them in particular. The coffee was decent - standard fare in airpots. What we came in for was the wi-fi, which was strong. The ladies at the counter were nice. I got a rugulach which was yummy. If you plan on only buying a coffee, I would bring cash. I think they charge a fee for a small transaction. There were many folks there working on laptops. We sat on the couch facing the window, which was shabby and filled with crumbs but not dirty. I love the cute Parisian murals. Overall, this place is spacious, has free wi-fi and bathrooms with good service! Thanks Cafe Enchantee.
author: Nancy G.

description:
I have finally found a cafe that is conducive to my needs. It has lots of study space, free WiFi, your standard array of cafe' beverages, yummy chai, a good choice of munchies and above all else...piroshkis !!! Now, I don't go out of my way for these things, but when I had the beef and mushroom piroshki, I knew that this place and I were kismet. I know this because ever since my first one, I had to have another one. 

   I stocked this place for three weeks whenever I got a chance to pass by for another bite at this piroshki that I had to have a second take at. Each time they were out. There was even one time when I asked the nice Asian gal that was working that day," Where have all the piroshkis gone?" She replied with a smile, " The piroshki machine is broken!"  Shucks!!! But finally, today was the day. Must have been the luck o' the GIANTS !!! I had one warmed up in house, two to go, and one for Mom. They are that good. So for a cafe that offers all that I mentioned with piroshkis, this is your place. 

C'est bon Cafe Enchante' !
author: Granolia G.

description:
Friendly service, slightly on the quieter side for atmosphere (maybe to accommodate the estudiantes who are estudying?), good coffee, and a good selection of snacky eats.

Not only did they have the conventional types of table / chair setups, they had two full-on 3-person couches facing each other, separated by a coffee table.  I don't know about you folks, but I think that's pretty neat!

While I can't say that the coffee was better than Philz, it definitely held its own... and being that it's a small mom and pop style shop, I give them credit for stickin' it to the MAN!
author: Johnson N.

description:
this is one of my favorite cafes ever...and I go to cafes all the time

I love love love their vanilla chais! I live right down the street and I come here almost every day to get one. 

prices are pretty standard for the area and their free wifi is fast even when there are 10 people in their on their laptops.

Also try the rasperry strudel....only 75 cents and absolutely delicious!
author: Chelsea C.

description:
Enchante is one of those coffee places that won't steer you wrong. It's owned by a Vietnamese husband and wife. The wife is very sweet and friendly. The husband... not so much? He doesn't speak much, but he pretty much walks around the place and does frequent rounds to wipe water stains off your table. Don't mind it.

Two reasons why I really like Cafe Enchante: endless amount of seating and power strips. The coffee isn't the best, but it'll do just fine given the fact that I'm guaranteed a comfortable, clean, quiet, and great place to study for hours and hours. I like it here, but I wouldn't count on a great cup of Joe from Enchante. The coffee is mediocre, but I suggest coming here to get lots of work done for the day.
author: Linda T.

description: A very comfortable atmosphere, it's a decent place to talk or bring your laptop and study. The prices are average and it's a very unpretentious vibe. The WiFi is reliable and there are plenty of electric outlets. The hours are fairly decent for San Francisco (it doesn't close early in the evening) but the background music, chatter, and refrigerators don't make it a calm place. If you bring ear plugs or headphones, you'll be able to concentrate better but you can make do without.
author: Al S.

description:
I loves me some Enchante. This is my neighborhood cafe.

Idea of bliss: vanilla latte, almond croissant, couch, book.

Enchante has all of these things. And it is good.
author: Raymond P.

description: The perfect cafe. They use their space beautifully. I've sat in this cafe with a book for hours without feeling like I was taking up too much room. They make damn good cappuchinos and I adore their la panini (grilled cheese sandwich). The staff is professional and quick. Oh and my boyfriend and I have waxed poetic about how perfectly toasted their bagels are as well as their ability to always put just the right amount of cream cheese.
author: Angela S.

description: This place has a long overhaul history of owners from cafe euro to the enchante. Cafe enchante has made it at the top. Owners are friendly and so as people working there. I mostly see that beard man with black gown dress having good times. This cafe is for the diverse people. One complaint is that their wifii is like constipated at times. Other than that good ambience and good coffee.
author: Ogen D.

description:
10 Ruminations from "Paris", San Francisco
Location: Cafe...On - Sean - Tay

1. cRaZy thorough mural of the Rue de la Paix in Paris complete with functioning lion water fountain.
2. That clock on the top of the mural is not totally painted. Look again, that's the accurate time! Blew my mind balls when I realized it (3 hours later...)
3. SEVERAL seats w/ mini tables for us 1 seater folk needing to finish that damn thesis, homework, etc. (There's even a couple office desks with those wheeled, leather chairs!?!)
4. Big comfy couches for the socialites. 
5. Good for them for leaving power strips out so we all can plug in. 
6. Throw-back big band music with subtle notes of the shouting woman with the Chinese accent behind the counter (hahaha...Current song: "Baby, it's Cold Outside"....in June)
7. Little passive agressive signs around reminding customers that life ain't free: Like: Refills: 0.85 cents...only 3 times per day! Bathroom, customers only..if not.."TWO DOL-LAH. " 
8. Coffee...look: it's got caffeine...it's definitely no blue bottle...but not bad!
9. A bit "bu hao yi si" this afternoon with the loud arguing between owners and disgruntled patron in front of the crowded cafe...
10. Great avocado sandwich with whatever else you want!

In Sum: I don't hate it. Great for studying...and making awkward observations. 

All right, back to the damn thesis.
author: Patty Q.

description:
This place is nice!!!

I didn't get anything from here, but Cafe Enchante made a pretty big impression on me!

I love the decor; on one side you feel like you're out on a patio in Italy and the other side is like a regular coffee shop.  The walls have murals on them, the cafe has a piano, many couches, and computers in the back.

Their also a lot on the menu; coffee and food wise.  They have the usual espresso drinks (Lattes, Flavored Lattes, Capuccinos, Cafe Au Laits, Red Eyes, etc...) and the food choices were plenty too (Bagels, Bagels with cream cheese and tomato, etc...)  I wanted to get a bagel but their credit machine wasn't working =(.

But my friend did get a drip coffee and she said it was pretty good.

The atmosphere was very cozy and quiet.

Will go again next time!
author: Tanya T.

description:
Quaint and cozy, great for studying or a relaxing afternoon. Tall ceilings, art everywhere, and couches or tables to sit/lay on.

Enchante offers incredible pastries, decent coffee and a great casual environment. The chai lattes (vanilla, sweet but spicy)  are phenomenal, but the brewed coffee comes from spouts on those massive thermoses you see at continental breakfasts. In all honesty it's pretty GOOD coffee, brewed regularly, you might just have to shake the container a bit before pouring to get the best flavor out of it :)

But a word to the wise, try the strudel (.75 a pop). omg.
author: Luke F.

description:
This is a great cafe if you want a quiet place to study. They seem to cater to the laptop/wifi set, but they also have big comfy couches with ample space for bigger groups. Lots of beverage choices and sandwiches and snacks, too.
It is also half a block from several bus lines, which is nice.
author: Rachel M.

description:
For a number of years, a friend and I have met here to play chess. We had no idea it was changing owners, we always thought it was comfortable, and now with new furniture, it is even more so.

The place is really spacious, lots of areas to sit and compute, couches, chess tables, good coffee (my latte was starbucks quality, yay!) and pastries (strudel was scrumptious) a clean rest room, friendly barista, self serve water, it's a good place.
author: Sharon J.

description:
Rude, rude, RUDE!

The problem with first impressions is that you only get one.  I'm new to the city/neighborhood and have wanted to check this place out since I moved in because it looks really nice and I need a place to get a semi-daily coffee.  I finally did today.  The decor inside this place is really nice; it looks like some fancy hotel lounge from the 1920's.  The menu looks appetizing enough.  I decided on a small coffee and a breakfast sandwich.  When the redhead taking orders (who, mind you, has been mentioned several times in these negative reviews) waltzed up to the counter, she gave me no "good morning", no smile, no friendly look; nothing even in the vein of customer service or acknowledging my right to come into this establishment and be treated like a human being.   But, um, okay, whatever.  Start ordering.  Told her I want a breakfast sandwich.  "What kind of bagel", BARELY even came out of her mouth.  "Plain bagel".  "What kind of cheese?" she asked acidly.  I told her I wanted cheddar.

Now, at some point during this transaction I became so insulted that I actually started to mock her voice.  I don't know what possessed me to do this, but it was a compulsion I could not control.  I'm not going to be treated like this and not do SOMETHING to fight back.  And it definitely was not lost on her because she stopped dead in her tracks. She must not be challenged very often.

The girl actually making the sandwiches was RIDICULOUSLY nice! I mean, maybe it was just by comparison though.  Because again, redhead obviously doesn't want to be there, thinks she's better than everybody else, and even wants you to KNOW that she thinks she's better than you.

The food and coffee itself weren't too bad.  A little overpriced for what it was.  The sandwich was made with care and I appreciate that they use qualitly ingredients and don't microwave everything.

Again, I'm looking for a REGULAR place to go to.  So if it hadn't been for the fact that their cashier (and, by default, face of their organization) hadn't made me want to slash my wrists, I'd be coming back on a regular basis.  But nope, I'm gonna go someplace else that actually treats me like a person and appreciates my business.  She needs to be fired.

Maybe reverse roles of barrista and cashier?
author: Eric F.

description: I'm taking away 2 full stars because of the nasty redhead who works there.  Everything else is fine- friendly people, good sandwiches and drinks, plenty of comfy seating.  But that redhead is so sour.  She slams your drinks down on the counter and scowls the whole time.  When you approach the counter she doesn't even say hello, she just stares until you order.  I wonder how the owner tolerates such unpleasantness.
author: Theresa H.

description:
So let me preface this review by saying my experience today was 5 star but I am averaging it with a couple of my previous encounters with this cafe. I almost walked right past it today like I have done many days since my last visit where I was treated rudely by the young asian girls who normally work in the morning. I feel like they would be perfectly happy not to serve anyone who comes in. The are always sitting down behind the counter talking which is fine but please don't look so put out when a customer comes in. Its your job.

This morning was a whole different experience. I wish I asked the girls name behind the counter but she was a breath of fresh air big smile very attentive and helpful. I will be back come now. So to the redhead thanks for making me feel so welcome.
author: Buster K.

description: Pretty cute cafe! Went here this morning and tried the "elvis bagel".. it was really tasty!! My experience would've been more enchanting if the lady at the register were nice and there was more selection in pastries. I asked her what was in the turnovers and she looked at me like i was weird and said, "jam!" Geez!! Will i go back? Sure.. as long as she's not working..
author: Mertani G.

description:
Came here late night for a coffee craving.

Pretty cool place with a great atmosphere. Lots of big comfy seats, free WiFi I believe and also wall murals.

Nice menu which makes it so you can have funky coffee drinks. All in all a cool little experience was had here. I will be back. I still want to try a banana latte.
author: Anthony S.

description:
Cafe Enchante is my home away from home - I live a couple blocks away so its very easy to get to. Everyone who works there is friendly and if you like and its not busy will even chat for a few minutes. Like in "Cheers", they "know" my drink before I get up to the counter. 

 I usually sit in the front on the tall round tables, so I don't get quite as much of the "were in Europe feel", but the decor is very cute. (I like those front seats if I'm going to be sitting for awhile).  You can sit there for several hours and no one minds  (we want the place to stay in business, so make sure you are refreshing your drinks as the time passes.)  There is plenty of seating, lots of outlets and free wifi.  They have food, maybe not brilliant, but good for cafe bagels and sandwiches. They even offer a few options beyond the usual coffee house wheat fest.  The restroom is very clean and the music options are often entertaining... 

I find I can get a lot of work done here and highly recommend as a nice, clean (important to me), comfortable  place to come.
author: Debi H.

description:
My favorite cafe so far. The new owners really spiced the place up with their wall paintings. Looks excellent. Great vibe. Good atmosphere and the owners took effort in supplying more plugs for us old laptop owners who have batteries that don't last longer than 10 minutes. I frequent this place a few times a week. 

I've seen people get yelled at for not ordering anything and just sitting around soaking up the free internet. Well deserved. The "customer" buys a bottle of water, never drinks it and leaves it there when he leaves. Making a statement? He should know better. Cafe seating is for customers only. Duh. I usually get up every couple hours to buy something else if I plan to be there awhile.
author: Brian Q.

description:
Cafe Enchante serves good coffee and pastries in the Outer Richmond.  I think this place has changed ownership a couple of times.

Not wanting anything too complicated on a Sunday morning, I order a drip coffee plus blueberry coffee cake.  The drip coffee was better than average, not great but good enough.  Their coffee cake was surprisingly good as it was more crumbly top than cake (the way I like it).

You should know that their used to be a cellphone store adjacent to the previous coffee house owners.  It was a strange setup, but to each their own.  Today, the space is more seating for the coffee house but with a special twist.  The areas has walls that are nicely painted to give the feeling of being a French cafe.  Whoever the artist was did a great job painting the walls - a must see!  

Check out Cafe Enchante when your in the Outer Richmond - 3 stars for food/drink plus another star for the wall paintings.
author: Janet H.

description: I loved this place when I was studying for my lsat. The coffee is good and so are the sandwiches. My favorite one was the golden gate?? Turkey and deliciousness. One of the best sandwiches I've had in sf thus far..really! Too bad I don't live in that area anymore :/
author: Cesie A.

description:
I was irritated from having to drive around the block two or three times in the rain so having been texted, "meet me at the enchanted cafe" made for high expectations. 

And...they were met!  This cafe  is a delight!

IF I lived in the area, I would be here writing Yelps or working from Cafe Enchante because it is quiet, cute and spacious.  The coffee was good and if I'm in the area again I will definitely return.
author: Sarah Z.

description: I absolutely love this place!  I went here almost every morning during my vacation to visit my  brother and sister-in-law.  They live on Balboa, so it was a nice walk.  The coffee is excellent and strong, even the medium roast!  Cafe Enchante is very clean and the workers were nice!  The atmosphere is great and relaxing.  Also a great place to do some work or meet up with friends.  I miss my trip to the cafe now that I am back in New York.  San Francisco knows its coffee!
author: Virginia W.

description:
Awful chai latte.

The interior is pure cheese.
author: Jack K.

description:
It was Saturday morning in the Richmond district right before "dim sum hour" starts. I barely had to circle the block and almost immediately found a parking spot two blocks from the Enchante. That, I must say, is amazing. 

This was my first time visiting Enchante. As I walked into the big open space inside, I was happy to see that there were plenty of tables to sit at, power strips a few feet from each table, and wide windows that brought in natural lighting from outside. Good interior, Enchante!

Coffee was just "ehhh". It tasted a bit... sour. Not sure if I've ever had sour coffee, but perhaps it was just the type of coffee I chose that morning. I'll give the coffee another go or just get a hot apple cider next time. 

Excellent staff. Restrooms were okay.
author: Teresa Y.

description: Really great cafe for studying. There was tons of seating and it was very quiet and easy to concentrate here. The decoration is really adorable and very cozy. Free wifi was a little slow but other people didn't seem to have a problem. Really good selection of drinks and food. I got a pot of tea and it was really big so I got my moneys worth. I also tried the Mediterranean turnover they had in the case next to the register and it was really yummy. Service was a little slow, but workers were really nice and I like the place so much I won't dock a star for that. Great place, I will be coming back!
author: Julie C.

description: Will not return. Ordered a latte but the person obviously didn't know anything about coffee. She got me something between a latte and cappuccino instead. The foam was horribly made too. I came here last year and it was totally different now. If you just need free WiFi and a place to sit, you might like this place. But not for coffee lover.
author: Vic L.

description:
removed 3 times, about the redhead, mental case.

1, The food is not so good, and the customer service is terrible. 
They will blame customer for their own mistake.
I'm taking away 4 full stars because of the nasty redhead who works there.  Everything else is fine- friendly people, plenty of comfy seating.  But that redhead is so sour.  She slams your drinks down on the counter and scowls the whole time.  When you approach the counter she doesn't even say hello, she just stares until you order.  I wonder how the owner tolerates such unpleasantness.

2,Will not return. Ordered a latte but the person obviously didn't know anything about coffee. The nasty redhead who works there, she got me something between a latte and cappuccino instead. The foam was horribly made too. I came here last year and it was totally different now. If you just need free WiFi and a place to sit, you might like this place. But not for coffee lover.

3.Rude, rude, RUDE!
The problem with first impressions is that you only get one.  I'm new to the city/neighborhood and have wanted to check this place out since I moved in because it looks really nice and I need a place to get a semi-daily coffee.  I finally did today.  The decor inside this place is really nice; it looks like some fancy hotel lounge from the 1920's.  The menu looks appetizing enough.  I decided on a small coffee and a breakfast sandwich.  When the redhead taking orders (who, mind you, has been mentioned several times in these negative reviews) waltzed up to the counter, she gave me no "good morning", no smile, no friendly look; nothing even in the vein of customer service or acknowledging my right to come into this establishment and be treated like a human being.   But, um, okay, whatever.  Start ordering.  Told her I want a breakfast sandwich.  "What kind of bagel", BARELY even came out of her mouth.  "Plain bagel".  "What kind of cheese?" she asked acidly.  I told her I wanted cheddar.

Now, at some point during this transaction I became so insulted that I actually started to mock her voice.  I don't know what possessed me to do this, but it was a compulsion I could not control.  I'm not going to be treated like this and not do SOMETHING to fight back.  And it definitely was not lost on her because she stopped dead in her tracks. She must not be challenged very often.

4.Ordered grilled cheese sandwich and got food poisoning. REALLY bad, Up-All-Nite food poisoning. Terrible. But a decent enough place to do some work. Will be bringing bottled water and eating packaged granola bars from this place from now on, though.

5.I have been to this cafe multiple times foolishly thinking ( or hoping, maybe) that their poor service was just a matter of circumstance on that particular day- I was wrong. The chinese lady behind the counter creates a confused and chaotic energy because she doesn't know english and can't understand and provide what the customers need. The cakes are really old and dry and the cookies were moldy- no penicillin for me thanks!

6.I live near this cafe and I love going here to do some homework or research when i'm sick of being inside my house. It's so near. I've been here to get drinks, and it was great. But not until today, that all has changed for me. I only give this 1 star because of the great homey interior feeling. I ordered a chicken sandwich and as I took a bite and lay the sandwich back on the plate, I saw on the other half of my sandwich there was a long strand of hair. I walked disgustedly and unimpressed and told them that there was hair on my sandwich. They took the sandwich and said sorry and smiled. I'm cool with getting a new one, but as I walk away I hear them laughing at the hair while they play with the strand and see how long and what color it was. It was gross. If this was a great establishment, they would've accommodated me better like other places. BUT NO! I don't think I like the service that was provided here today.
author: Nobu K.

description:
Came here during The baby shower Ricci threw at our house.

Great little place to have some good coffee or tea and read quietly.  Free wifi and comfy seats make it a great place to spend a few hours in the neighborhood.
author: Jeff S.

description:
It used to be Cafe Mono, then it was Cafe Europa, and now it is Cafe Enchante.
I did not frequent this place in the past so I can write an unbiased review not comparing it with the past establishments.  I guess Cafe Mono was okay..don't remember much about it anymore though.  
Anyway, Cafe Enchante is a pretty nice spot to chat or study.  It's located at the corner so it's convenient too.  Mochas are pretty good here and the servers are nice enough.  I like that I can study here all day too!  The place is spacious and clean. Clean bathroom and nice ambiance in general.
author: Tu L.

description:
Why would ANYONE operate a "coffee house" and serve crappy coffee? I just don't get it.

I keep on trying this place - in the unrequited hope that I will actually get a good cup of coffee here one day. It just doesn't happen. I "beef-up" a coffee with a shot of espresso, just to get it decent enough to drink.

Makes no sense to me.
author: John H.

description:
Roll out of bed and
Come here almost everyday
Cafe Enchante
_____

They've been through three names in three years, it seems, but each iteration of this Cafe is a little better than the previous one.  I used to only pop in on my way to work while waiting for the 38 Geary, but lately I've been their best customer.  They have free wifi, and since I'm funemployed and without internet at home (and I don't cook), I roll out of bed around noon, come to Cafe Enchante and get coffee and food, and spent the next 7-8 hours applying to jobs all day long.  The staff are nice and don't seem to mind at all that I'm a total internet mooch.  I also haven't had anything stolen yet, even though I walk away from my belongings to go to the potty all the time.

Their food and coffee are pretty good and reasonably priced, but nothing worth driving all the way across the city to try.  The main draw is that their internet is truly free and fast and there are always a few empty seats with a nearby electrical outlet.  They also play decent elevator jazz to soothe my nerves as I type in my employment history for the Xth time of the day.

Thanks Cafe Enchante.
author: Jin D.

description:
Don't order the hot apple cider.

If you choose to do so, you can look forward to drinking store-brand apple juice, microwaved, with a cinnamon stick dropped-in.

Oh, and if you mention to the manager that the "hot apple cider" was actually just warmed-up apple juice, they'll let you know that that iiisss apple cider. Well, gee thanks for the clarification. I'll just spit out the hot apple juice now.
author: Meg M.

description: Coffee is okay. Asian Baristas are cute, nice and friendly. Love their selection of Tea's and Tuna Sandwiches.  Internet can be slow sometimes - owners should buy a new/better/stronger  router.
author: Craig H.

description:
Cafe Enchante -- I'm enchanted.

This café is adorable.  And spacious -- a rarity in San Francisco.  I've been coming here as an alternative to Simple Pleasures Cafe, which has a very different vibe.  The crowd here seems a bit more studious and less chatty, at least during the daytime.  I like the decor, the European-looking mural, and the eclectic (but not too eclectic - aka chaotic) assemblage of furnishings.

I'm pretty discriminating when it comes to coffee after living in Seattle, but I'll admit to occasionally drifting back to my Midwestern roots and I'll go for the lighter, flavored stuff; Cafe Enchante has Hazelnut and Vanilla Nut as drip options, in addition to the more standard grounds.

They also have a good assortment of snacks.  I usually order a bagel with cream cheese, though I've had my eye on the savory turnovers and piroshkys ... yum.

Major brownie points for the clean environment.  I regularly see the staff wiping down tables and sweeping the floor.

The only thing this cute coffee house is missing is a certain buzz that I seek in a cool neighborhood shop.  I think Cafe Enchante just needs time to generate a stronger identity.  Hopefully, it will get the chance to establish itself.
author: Jamie T.

description: I like this place. I've gotten the brewed coffee and iced tea. It's a good place to meet people and sit and chat. Free wifi makes it so some people stay forever and then finding a seat is hard. It a nice and chill place with friendly staff. They have comfy couches and chairs. They also have a few tables outside.
author: Annie P.

description:
Their coffee is definitely NOT a reason to come here. The outlets and power strips ARE. 

I frequent this coffee shop to study and quickly meet some looming deadlines. Resulting in me having lots of coffee, meals and cigarette breaks. By the end of the my 8 hr stretch this place feels like home. 

It is ALOT better now than when it was "cafe euro", the workers are nicer, their bathroom cleaner, and the couches without pee (always a plus). 

PS. the lady today wouldn't sell me an iced macchiato and says that Starbucks makes it wrong. This is the 2nd local coffee shop to refuse to sell me an iced macchiato. Starting to think my favorite Starbucks drink is a fabricated corporate drink =(
author: Jane N.

description: Nice cafe with good offer, coffee and sandwiches are good.
author: Andrea K.

description:
I came in Saturday morning for a coffee and a breakfast sandwich, and although the place was sooooo busy, the girls working behind the counter were super sweet and accommodating.  Considering how crazy it was, the service was quick and friendly, and the coffee was sooooo delicious and the sandwich was fresh and awesome--worth the wait as it was tailored to my fussy needs regarding toasting, etc.  The place has a comfortable, pleasant ambience, and the free wifi was perfect for me to finish some school projects I have been working on.  I'm not sure why other Yelpers are complaining about "the redhead"--unless more than one redhead works there?--because I indeed was happily helped by a girl with long red hair, and she was so sweet and friendly to me (and everyone else), that it's hard for me to imagine her being as rude as Eric F mentioned below.  Out of curiosity (and, frankly, procrastinating from my project), I looked at some other reviewers--specifically, Eric F since he seems driven to suicide by his experience--and it seems like he thinks pretty much everyone is ueber rude--even his only five-star review noted the unwelcoming staff.  And seriously--a Domino's Pizza review that complains about the temperature of the pizza?  Maybe Eric can review McDonald's next and complain about the quality of the meat in the cheeseburger.
Overall, this place is great.  I would suggest that the sandwiches be priced about $1 or $1.50 less expensively (if I were to make this a regular haunt that could seriously add up), but good work / coffee / food station for sure.  I would give the place the full five were it just a teeeeeny bit more affordable for regular visitation.
author: Kennau K.

description:
Whatever happened in here, is awesome.

  Whoever removed the staunch, uninviting, tiny tables and replaced them with comfy armchairs, I thank you.

  And whoah, to the muralist(s) who created the masterpiece that is now your walls, I salute you!  Amazing work, makes me feel like I've taken a sidestep to a French rue.

  Lastly, thank you for retaining some of the same staff from Cafe Euro (the nice ones).
author: Lea N.

description: I really enjoy this coffee shop! The employees are kind and helpful, and the coffee and smoothies are great. I spend a lot of time here doing homework and the atmosphere is great for studying, working on projects and simply browsing the web. I really appreciate the free wifi, and the self serve ice cold water. My favorite employee is Bridgette. She always greats me with a smile.
author: Erin B.

description:
I can't help but feel like I'm sitting in the n Paris Las Vegas because of the interior decor.  Really, it's just like the hotel!  Which makes it all kind of cute.  

I visited for the first time today in the afternoon so there were plenty of tables open.  I chose to sit right by the window which helped me focus on my task at hand rather than the ambiance of the place.  I ordered a medium Americano ($2.45) and was surprised at how good it was.  The coffee was not too dark and bitter.  

I really liked that this place was calm and quiet but it was a Thursday afternoon.  I'm sure it's not so mellow on a Saturday.  Regardless, a nice place to sit and read.  I will definitely come back!  The only thing that weirded me out was when I asked the owner for the internet  password.  The whole scene was very mafia-like.  She just looked at me, flipped over a piece of paper with the password, then returned to working. Okay...........
author: Helen V.

description: I've lived near this convenient, relatively friendly café for a little more than two years. There is, in fact, no other place that I go to for a local cup of coffee. But I can't sit for more than 5 minutes in this place without being creeped out by the herd of slightly off-putting people wearing headphones and typing on laptops. Essentially, it's a laptop farm - with decent food (vegan blueberry bread!) and coffee, some fancy lighting, and a bathroom. Service has always been okay, but I've had a few unpleasant/confusing  experiences - usually at night - when there's only one employee. Overall, it's not bad but it certainly isn't anything exciting.
author: Eva J.

description:
I'd give four and half stars if I could.

Comfortable armchairs & couches, plus desk and table areas for all of those out there who need flat areas to work.  They have fairly good background muzac that serves as a distraction, but not distracting.  Their food and coffee drinks are well-priced and decent, and they have an amazing tea selection.  Every time I've come here it's been quiet, even when there are children present.  It is a good place to get work done.
author: Margee B.

description: The only somewhat decent part of this cafe is the how spacious it is.  You can easily get work done.  But I believe a cafe should not just have a good ambiance, but it should have decent coffee and  fresh snacks.  Cafe Enchante lacks both, though I like the space I will not go there again as I have found many a cafe with not only a comfortable atmosphere but good coffee and somewhat fresh food.
author: Jessica B.

description:
Since all the other cafes we tried to go to were closed by the time we wanted coffee, which was 7 pm, it was such a delight to find this place. I love how it's open generally late!

The barista was very friendly. I was torn on what type of chai tea I wanted and he kindly recommended the vanilla. I loved my choice! It tasted like a light cinnamon roll, kinda reminding me like Christmas! The other beverage we had was the iced latte. It wasn't your sugary latte like they make in Starbucks, but how a latte should be, coffee!!!

The atmosphere is very inviting. Basically two sections, one for relaxation on sofas to carry out conversations, and a section the the back that holds mostly table seats. The mural is beautiful, surrounding a indoor fountain. 

We had a wonderful type talking and enjoying our beverages.
author: JQ V.

description: Coffee & food are the usual fair, but this cafe is clean, well lit with plenty of seating and free wifi. Staff are friendly and includes a lady who is Khmer...offers an excellent opportunity to brush up on my Khmer. I certainly can't ask for a better neighborhood coffee shop.
author: Garlic B.

description:
I can't say enough about this cafe!  Tranquil ambiance coupled with decent  coffee.  (Wish they had individual drip brews, however)

The proprietors are very lovely and their French background makes them very appealing.

This place makes a mean breakfast bagel!!!
author: Steve M.

description: This is a really cute cafe and the Enchante bagel, hot apple cider, and lattes are delicious.  It's in a great location (about a block from routes 29 and 38) and the bathroom's clean, too.  The only downside is that it can get busy and a little stuffy in the cafe.
author: M. N.

description: If I were still a student, I would probably come here. Looks like a good place to settle in for a couple hours and get some work done. For just stopping in to get coffee, though, it's not that great. The coffee is just ok. The hand-made signs that tell you how much it will cost you for a refill, or that you will be charged $2 to use the bathroom are a little off-putting.
author: Patrick S.

description: Wow what a neat little cafe! My friend recommended us coming here this weekend to study and it was a great choice! The ambiance is just perfect and depicts what a real cafe should be. It's not loud at all, with light soothing music in the background, it's easy to get lost in your books. There's also plenty of seating whether it be couches or tables. And the french vanilla coffee is just delightful!
author: Sharon G.

description: This place is awesome! The background sounds are good for studying (waterfall, random music playing at low-volume) except for when the roudy come in herds and talk up a storm, and the interior design is rather endearing (European cafe-esque). There is plenty of seating and outlets for laptop charging, FREE INTERNET, good fare drink selection (though i don't recommend their french soda), and computers for use.
author: Lana L.

description: Great coffee, great decor. Came here before going to Jang Soo BBQ with my cousin. I can only vouch for the coffee, since I didn't want to stuff myself, but the price and setting made me want to return - this just might be the spot to wait for movies at the 4-Star!
author: Marcus M.

description: I am self-employed and I have to change it up and get out of the house to work on a regular basis.  I often meet my great friend here to work and study together.  I end up spending approx. 6-8 hours here working.  There is free unlimited wi-fi, the cafe is immaculately clean, and the staff are extremely friendly.  I've gotten to know most of them and they are always welcoming.  The food is good too, if you like bagels and sandwiches.  There's always an outlet to use nearby the tables, and the ambiance and music are very enjoyable.  I highly recommend this cafe for studying and working.  It's light, with plenty of window lighting, and convenient as it's located right next to the Geary 38 bus line.
author: Sylvia S.

description:
Loved the blended green tea latte and the breakfast bagel was very good too, had a nice local vibe and unique decor. 

Super friendly staff topped off my sunday afternoon lunch here.
author: Michael D.

description: The coffee wasn't very good and I had a really bad customer service experience.  Pretty much I wanted a double latte in a small cup.  The cashier charged me more for it than their medium latte which had the same amount of espresso and more milk.  Granted, it was only $.35 more, but it's pretty ridiculous to be charged more for less.  To make matters worse, when I tried to ask the cashier about it, she stared at me blankly until someone stepped in to help.  Maybe it was her English proficiency, but I got the feeling she was trying to brush it off.  She spoke English well enough otherwise.  She could have also been in training, but no one mentioned it, so I will assume she wasn't.  Anyway, I'll go to Art Bistro from now on unless I'm dying for caffeine while in the 20s (did I just borrow a Manhattanism?), and maybe then I'll just go to Royal Ground.
author: Daniel F.

description: Hands down, my favorite place to go for coffee and get work done. Everyone is very nice and there's ton of comfortable seating.
author: Kyle M.

description: The white chocolate, hands down the best I've had. You can actually taste the white chocolate more than Starbucks. Plus, this place is affordable! Sucks that it's out of my reach and I have to take at least a 30 minute bus ride there but I'll be back!
author: Michelle D.

description: Really cozy place that does not feel stuffy. Free Internet.  Provides comfortable tables as well as lounging couches. Not too packed. But may be after this post it will be. Oh well.
author: Arthur K.

description:
I love coming in here to study! The barista has always been super nice and offers to adjust my latte to my taste (since I have no complaints about the coffee this hasn't been necessary, but I appreciate the offer). 

I don't eat meat and was pleasantly surprised with their willingness, and suggestions, to make substitutions on their breakfast sandwiches. The Mona Lisa veggie sandwich is delicious! In fact all of the sandwiches I've had here are good. Haven't tried the pastries yet though. 

The atmosphere is pleasant and great for getting work done. You can't beat the free wireless either.  I'm psyched that this is my local coffee shop
author: Kat O.

description: This place is great!  I've always had excellent service and whenever in the neighborhood I always stop in.  Being in a wheelchair makes it hard to access many places, but at Cafe Enchante it is vey friendly.  Try the large hot chocolate with a double shot of coconut.
author: Robert G.

description: This is a great café for sitting down and getting some work done. Quiet, lovely atmosphere, great decor. Food's reasonable - nothing special, but the important part for me is that I can sit down and get some peace and quiet. No tourists, no loud yuppies.
author: Brighid M.

description: Not everyone can make iced coffee yummy! Cute decor, nice & open. Love the decor. Will be back!
author: Dana S.

description: It's basically a study hall with free wi-fi. Food and drinks are institutional. Nothing special. Looking for a place to work for hours? This might work well for ou.
author: John S.

description: This place saved me when I moved here from Boston in March. It was always raining we were in a furnished rental I hated and this place let me come, work on the computer have some yummy hazelnut coffee and a great veggie sandwich. Everyone that works here is so sweet.
author: Noelle M.

description:
This is the place-unusual and strange!
I had two times bagels and tea, I always had problems with my stomach.
2 times I had to call emergency after I had very bad pain in my tummy!
Also, I had business trip via 10 states.I did a lot of visits in a lot of places.
So, I have experience: this place Cafe Enchante-not hospital and owner, she always complains on some customers that  they did t  spend enough money to be so long in this place(though always as I noticed some even gave tips around 10 US dollars).
I would NOT recommend anybody place with such strange energy.
I have over 12 years experience in food service, as well.
I always recommend to owners pass special classes of hospitality and public service.
God Bless San Francisco,
Steven Jackobson
former Law enforcement agent
10/13/11
I heard as a Lady,seems she is owner:yelling! You have hot water, but no honey. What happened, the very respectable person (can t mention his name) once in a while buying coffee+hot water(for medicine).I asked him.The owner stated: u can t have extra honey!
B.sh. THIS IS USA! YOU HAVE TO RESPECT AND TREAT EACH CUSTOMER NICE.
ASIAN PEOPLE DON T LIKE EUROPEAN ONES. SEEMS LIKE...ALAS
GOD BLESS YOU....BUT LEARN! YOU NEVER KNOW WHO WILL BE YOUR CUSTOMER:MAYBE UNDERCOVER AGENT? (PUBLIC, FOOD SERVICE):)
author: Rita J.

description:
Great place to:
-Sit with your laptop and work all day (free wifi!). Plenty of seating and outlets.
-Have a conversation with a friend

Tried the Chai latte, and it was good. Nothing extraordinary - I actually prefer Starbucks' Tazo Chai Latte.

But, for the ambience, I keep returning =)
author: Sooji H.

description:
This is what a coffee house should be...

Comfy
Clean
Cheap
Free Wi-Fi


Yes, the food isn't all that great, the coffee is just average, the atmosphere is a bit cheesy, but who cares?  The owners are really nice and they keep their place running really well.  I like how unpretentious the place is.  Now I've never been to France and I'm pretty sure this place looks nothing like France, but hey, at least they try.  (Owners are Vietnamese, but they speak fluent French).  I look forward to doing work and studying at this place every Friday for a couple of hours after I get off of work.  

The only reason I give it four stars is because their food isn't that great.  It would be awesome if they served pho.  I should patent that idea.  Pho at a coffee shop would be awesome...

Another knock is that it could get noisy.  A lot of idiots come in there, talk hella loud on their phone, and bug everybody inside.  But that's not the owners fault.  Go outside you freakin' hipsters....

The couches also remind me of the old seats on a BART train.  Old, discolored, squishy, and probably filled with all sorts of vile diseases.

In my mind, it adds to this place.  The fact that they're cheap, they aren't trying to be hip or cool, and they know what they're doing keeps me coming back each time.
author: SAS Z.

description: its a great place with a lot of tables and a water fountain inside so its nice and peaceful! i love this place but the coffee is not the best. It definitely is not bad, but not my favorite. The place is family owned so its nice to support them. Very friendly too!
author: Himali V.

description: I like the ambiance. Lots of space to sit and relax. The mural looks really nice. there are many choices for  regular coffee. I usually stop by for a quick breakfast before going to work. Nice people working there. I will keep going back for sure.
author: Nil G.

description: Went here todo some work while waiting on someone. Lots of space and outlets for people. Coffee was good and crumbcake was tasty.
author: Minh H.

description: 5 stars for being my daily study/work spot since its so close to where I live. Free wi-fi, good coffee, and plenty of electrical outlets. I stay here for hours to do work.
author: Trish P.

description: Ordered grilled cheese sandwich and got food poisoning. REALLY bad, Up-All-Nite food poisoning. Terrible. But a decent enough place to do some work. Will be bringing bottled water and eating packaged granola bars from this place from now on, though.
author: paul b.

description: Coffee totally blah. Espresso drinks a bit pricey. Atmosphere spacious but tacky. Service a bit abrupt.
author: Geoffrey U.

description: The chai latte here is amazing if you like it sweet. This is a good place to spend quality time with your laptop and eventually order a sandwich when your stomach starts making conversation- but there are hovering  Mediterranean-scape murals everywhere you look.
author: Lyrica T.

description: Plentiful outlets for computer usage, a lot of tables, and one unisex bathroom.  I am not sure if this cafe is owned by Asians or not but they seem to be running the cafe.  A lot of the baked goods are from outside vendors. I got the white mocha (small size) for $3.00.  Overall a good place to go if you live around here or if you score a parking spot with no hourly limit.  I did not feel very enchanted in the cafe but there were some couches. Wifi speed was pretty decent during the mid-afternoon.  A password is required to use the wifi and there is no hourly limit.
author: Jboogie L.

description: Why all the haterade?  I work AT a coffee shop and I come to this place to get my coffee and drinks.  I haven't actually tried any of their drinks besides a chai latte (which was just not flavored enough for my taste) but oh their savory pastries!  I've had the french provencal and the broccoli/cheese and they were both delicious.  The wait staff is nice (aka they are friendly at the register and leave me the hell alone once I sit down no matter how long I stay), the music is soft, the chairs are comfy, and the wifi is free!  If you don't consider that awesomeness well then...you suck.
author: Mailah G.

description:
I'm a big fan of this place. However it does have a couple minuses in my book. I love the ambiance of the place, and it's crazy convenient for me. The smoothies are bomb! And the coffee has yet to be anything but fresh. Please don't get me wrong I do love this place but.......

There is always a line and a longer than average wait for your order. The staff is never happy which is probably to do with the fact they are under payed and over worked. 

Definitely give em a try and I'm sure you'll find this places worth. As in all aspects of life nothings perfect.
author: Lexi P.

description: A wonderful place for a hot drink, a snack, and some peace and quiet. There are plenty of small tables for you to do work or study, and nice comfy couches for reading. Not the kind of place you'd have to fight tooth and nail to get a seat. Also, the food and drinks here are relatively inexpensive.
author: Cathy A.

description: This is a cute cafe, but they get one star off for not really knowing anything about French.  For example, they write "la panini" when panini is masculine. It is your business -- educate yourself!
author: Kelly M.

description:
I love this cafe. It's the closest one to my new house, so I went there first. I tried the other cafes in the neighborhood, Art Bistro, Simple Pleasures, and Cafe Zephyr, and this is still my favorite. The coffee's good-not great, but good. They have lots of stuff for sale-bagels, croissants, Russian tea cakes, cookies, candy bars, ramen noodles (no idea why) and sandwiches. Kind of a "throw everything at the wall and see what sticks" approach, but given that the cafe is fairy new and in an area with three other cafes, I can understand. I go here to read or do homework-it is undoubtedly on of the more comfortable cafe's in the city. The couches are new and clean and firm, not dirty and sagging like in many other cafes. The whole place is kept very clean, including the bathroom. You'll see the owner and his wife walking around in the afternoons sweeping up and wiping things down. They have a huge, executive-style desk with a leather-bound office chair set up in the corner, complete with power strip, the perfect location to get work done. I jokingly say I'm "going to the office" when I take my laptop there to write a paper. The food is pretty good. I usually get the Bay Club sandwich, made with turkey and bacon. I always get it on sourdough. It's not as big as some other cafe sandwiches I've seen but it feels you up. It comes with a goodly amount of mayonnaise, which I like, but others might find it too "wet" for their tastes. 
 So, the food and coffee are good, not the best, but more than passable. But where this place really shines is the ambience. Most of the cafe is filled with a Parisian street scene mural. There is a small fountain installed into a side wall. French accordion music plays on the radio. The place can come across, initially, as cheesy theme restaurant, but they keep the French theme sufficiently restrained. The staff doesn't wear barrettes or speak in fake accents or anything, and sometimes, when the owners aren't around, the staff changes the music to more standard Indie-rock fare you'll find in most cafes. There is a very eclectic mix of people there- college students doing homework, Chinese couples arguing with their children, old men playing checkers at one of the many checkerboard tables, even the black-robed priests of the Russian Orthodox cathedral across the street are a common sight. It's a very comfortable and relaxing place and is one of my favorite spot to chill out.
author: Eli H.

description: Well was a regular customer here (key word being "WAS") I will never feel ripped off by giving that place another cent! 1st they CHANGED THE COFFEE to this cheap watered down crap. Way to save a buck cheap skates.  And what almost made me vomit was the LONG STRAIGHT BLACK HAIR I found in my sandwich from that asian lady who made it YUCK!!!!! It's called a HAIR NET look into it!
author: mike g.

description: Cafe Enchante is a nice place with decent coffee and free wifi. A variety of seating is available (tables, sofas, chairs, even a few small desks), and the staff seems very friendly.
author: C G.

description: Place looks really nice inside. But a chai latte thats 25% liquid and 75% foam for $3 something. No thank you.
author: M M.

description: I live near this cafe and I love going here to do some homework or research when i'm sick of being inside my house. It's so near. I've been here to get drinks, and it was great. But not until today, that all has changed for me. I only give this 1 star because of the great homey interior feeling. I ordered a chicken sandwich and as I took a bite and lay the sandwich back on the plate, I saw on the other half of my sandwich there was a long strand of hair. I walked disgustedly and unimpressed and told them that there was hair on my sandwich. They took the sandwich and said sorry and smiled. I'm cool with getting a new one, but as I walk away I hear them laughing at the hair while they play with the strand and see how long and what color it was. It was gross. If this was a great establishment, they would've accommodated me better like other places. BUT NO! I don't think I like the service that was provided here today.
author: Paul C.

description: parking was pretty easy around the corner. sat morning it was quiet. we met here for a group meeting of 10+  and were comfortable in the couches. nice space and the staff even cleared our tables while we were meeting so we could have more room on the table which was nice. I only had tea so can't comment on the food/drinks.
author: Win H.
